loans.name: Jikaze Group

texts.en:
Jikaze is a group of 15 farmers in Bungoma South District and is represented by Dorise. The group has 11 women and four men. Dorise is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Dorise first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Dorice joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to access the best input prices. 


Dorise described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. Dorise’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is from the city of mombasa. She is married with five children and works as a merchant. She has been the owner of a food store for two years. She is making headway with the business having attracted a good number of customers who appreciate her very well-stocked store. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses and continue to improve her business over time.

She is requesting a loan to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other merchandise. This way, she can continue to provide customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES and it is projected to be enough to restock her business.

loans.use: to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has paid off her previous loan successfully and now has embarked on a tomato farming business. She has managed to work a large portion of her farm using proceeds from the previous loan.

She has requested another loan from KADET LTD to buy farm supplies and pay for labor. She plans to diversify her farm, growing fruits in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and insecticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man living with his wife and only one child.  After gaining many years of experience in his present occupation, he was able to open his own barbershop almost five years ago. He also got his wife’s support, especially after facing bad financial situations. She works in a travel agency. 

Due to his good business reputation, he was capable of building up a clientele of a good number of loyal customers. With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase shaving equipment and supplies, in addition to renovating his shop’s interior. In that way, he will satisfy his customers' demand and serve them with excellence. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to open a new branch of his shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase shaving equipment and supplies in addition to renovating his shop’s interior.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 58 años de edad y se dedica a la distribución de carne de res, desde hace 5 años. Su negocio fue trasmitido de generación en generación, pues toda su familia se ha dedicado a esa actividad; sus principales clientes son las tiendas, a quienes vende toda clase  de carne, molida, hígado, costillas etc. El diariamente  inicia su jornada,  desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 12 del dia y de lunes a sábado. Su principal proveedor es el matadero mas importante de la región, a quien le compra a crédito y de contado, para vender su producto  de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, carne de res, para continuar con su propósito de ampliar la base de clientes y finalmente ganar más, para ayudar a sus nietos en el logro de estudios con calidad.
texts.en: Ricardo is 58 years old and has been a butcher for 5 years. His business has been passed down from generation to generation and his whole family works in the business. His main clients are stores to whom he sells all types of meat, such as ground meat, liver, ribs, etc.  He starts his day at 4 in the morning and works until noon, Monday through Saturday. His main provider is the most important slaughterhouse in the region where he buys on credit as well as cash and then turns around and sells his products for cash. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With his loan he will buy larger quantities of beef so that he can keep building his client base and eventually earn more so he can help provide quality education for his grandchildren.

loans.use: purchase a larger quantities of beef.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is a 28-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a one-year-old daughter, Argie operates a retail store in the community. She sells basic commodities, like pouch vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, soaps, spices, canned goods, and noodles. She has been in the retail business for three years.

Argie requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional merchandise, such as soft drinks and rice. Argie would like to invest in other business  ventures to support the needs of her growing child, at the same time, saving for her child's future education.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her store, such as soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es: Jaime de 42 años de edad, vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hijo en la edad de 14 años. Él trabaja en una granja donde se cultivan frutas, verduras y hortalizas y también tiene una actividad comercial, mediante la cual se dedica a la venta de calzado deportivo y ropa para caballeros, aprovechando que su cónyuge trabaja en un taller de confecciones, donde puede obtener mejores precios por los productos que elaboran en esa empresa, aunque también compra en centros comerciales especializados que le ofrecen buenos precios. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito  y planea ampliar el surtido de productos,  pues tiene una meta de crecimiento empresarial para poder adquirir su casa propia y este es un gran desafio, pues debe hacerlo poco a poco. Esta es la razón para que en la actualidad esté aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará jeans, suéteres para caballeros y calzado deportivo, los cuales tiene encargado y forman parte de su estrategia para hacer crecer su mercado.
texts.en: Jaime is 42 years old and lives southwest of the city with his spouse and their 14 year old son. He works on a farm where he grows fruits, greens and vegetables. He also has a business selling athletic shoes and men’s clothing, taking advantage of his spouse’s work in a clothing factory where he obtains better prices for the products that they make. He also buys from specialized shopping centers that offer good prices. He sells on credit and plans to increase his stock because his goal is to grow his business so that he can purchase his own home. Since this is a huge challenge he must do it little by little. This is why he is currently applying for a Kiva loan with which he will buy jeans, men’s sweaters and athletic shoes, which he has ordered and is part of his strategy to grow his business.

loans.use: purchase jeans, men's sweaters and athletic shoes.

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es: Adriana de 40 años de edad vive en un sitio turístico, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 17 y 19 años. Allí tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende cervezas, que inició hace nueve (9) años, cuando su cónyuge tenia su estadero en otro barrio, en el que en ese momento vivía; al mudarse   al sitio donde actualmente habita, ubicado  muy cerca a la ciénaga de Mallorquin, ecosistema de gran importancia para el desarrollo sostenible de la región, y sitio muy visitado por turistas, decidió empezar a vender cervezas en un Kiosco adquirido para ese fin, y  que poco a poco lo convirtió en un estadero,  con el genera ingresos adicionales que benefician a su familia. Adriana y su esposo cuentan con los enseres necesarios para el desarrollo de esta actividad,  tienen 50 sillas, un equipo de sonido de gran potencia o PICK-UP y 2 enfriadores donde almacena la bebida. Ella trabaja solo los fines de semana y es muy apoyada por su familia todos los sábados, domingos y festivos,  desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.  Su meta es diversificar su oferta agregando comidas, que es una de las necesidades que debe solucionar en sus clientes mas adelante. En la actualidad Adriana está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario anto Domingo, con el cual comprará cervezas para provisionarse, pues la temporada de pre- carnaval y sus fiestas, hacen que aumente la demanda, que así mismo se intensifica durante los 4 días, en el que ocurre  una de las fiestas mas lindas del país : El carnaval de Barranquilla”  lleno de colorido, música tambores y diversidad de disfraces tradicionales, que emulan personajes del mundo, hechos ocurridos en el pasado y son la expresión sana del caracter alegre y cumbiambero, del pueblo caribe Colombiano, convirtiendose en un espectaculo para la gente de la Región y los visitantes de otros países y ciudades de Colombia, que llegan a la Barranquilla a disfrutarla .
texts.en:
Adriana is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 19, in a very popular tourist spot. There she has her own business selling beer. She began this business nine years ago when her family moved to its current location from another neighborhood. Now they live very close to the Mallorquín swamp, an ecosystem that is very important to the sustainable development of the region and highly visited by tourists. Adriana bought a kiosk and began to sell beer from there. Little by little, she has been converting the kiosk into an inn to generate more income for her family. 

Adriana and her husband rely on the equipment necessary to expand their business. They have 50 chairs, a PICK-UP or a very powerful sound system, and two coolers where they store drinks. Adriana works on holidays and weekends from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. She feels very supported by her family. Her goal is to diversify her menu and add food items, which her clients look forward to in the future. 

Adriana is requesting this Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use this loan to buy beer so she will be ready for the celebrations leading up to and during Carnival, when demand increases. During these four days the country's most incredible celebrations take place, including the colorful Carnival of Barranquilla, with much percussion music and a variety of traditional costumes from all over the world. Historical events are recreated and express the healthy, Caribbean, and joyful character of the Colombian village. It is a spectacular event for the region and many visitors from other countries and from all over Colombia come to enjoy it.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón Group

texts.es: Doña Carolina es una mujer alegre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene 43 años de edad, es originaria de una comunidad pintoresca llamada Curungueo, ella es parte de un grupo el cual se llama Sagrado Corazón ya que es el santo patrono de su comunidad y es por eso que le puso así al grupo. Ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes en un local que cerca de la carretera, dice  que puso ese negocio desde hace mas de 18 años y que lo puso en su comunidad por que antes no había una tienda bien surtida y para que la gente de su comunidad no gastara en pasajes para trasladarse a otra población ella abrió su abarrotera. En el mes de agosto ella se dedica hacer coronas para los muertos ya que es una tradición que en el mes de noviembre se les adorne las tumbas a los difuntos. Ella hace las coronas y unas las vende en su tienda de abarrotes y otras se las manda a su esposo quien tiene un vidriería en otra población llamada Zitacuaro. Ahorita ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abarrotes como productos no perecederos como atún, sardina, chiles en vinagre, aceite para cocinar, arroz, azúcar, canela molida, maicena, sopas,  gelatinas, papel higiénico, lentejas, sazonadores de pollo etc. ya que quiere mejorar su abarrotera para que sus clientes no se vayan a otros lugares a comprar productos. Su meta es tener su propio local para ya no pagar más rentas. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Laura, Yrene, María Cristina ellas invertirán su crédito en la compra de calzado de diferentes marcas para vender, para la compra de material para construcción para su venta y para surtir una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Carolina is a happy, hardworking, entrepreneur.  She is 43 years old.  She is originally from a picturesque community called Curungueo.  She is part of the Sacred Heart group, named after the patron saint of the community.  She has a grocery store in a place close to the road.  She started the business 18 years ago because her community at the time had no equivalently well stocked store.  She didn't want people to have to pay to travel to another location to shop.

In August, she makes wreaths for the dead as it is a tradition in November to decorate the graves of the dead.  She makes the wreaths and sells them in a grocery store and sends others to her husband who has a glassworks in the village of Zitacuaro.

Carolina is requesting a loan to purchase non-perishable groceries such as tuna, sardines, pickled chillies, cooking oil, rice, sugar, ground cinnamon, cornstarch, soups, jellies, toilet paper, lentils, poultry seasonings, etc.  She wants to improve the selection in her store so that her customers do not go elsewhere to shop.  Her goal is to own her own shop so that she no longer has to pay rent.  

The other group members include Laura, Yrene, and María Cristina.  They will use loan proceeds to buy different brands of shoes to sell, to purchase building materials for sale, and to stock a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy tuna, sardines, chili peppers in vinegar, cooking oil, rice, sugar, ground cinnamon, cornstarch, soups, jelly, toilet paper, lentils, chicken seasonings, etc., for a grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo, sus hijos están casados no viven con ellos, ella tiene cinco años de estar vendiendo ropa y fabrica manteles y cubrecamas, él negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que son comerciantes, de este negocio obtiene lo necesario para el hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para elaborar cubrecamas y manteles, adquiriendo retazos de tela de diferentes colores, entre otra mercadería, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar sus inventarios y sus ingresos.
La aspiración de María es fortalecer su negocio y brindarse una mejor calidad de vida con su esposo y tambien ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old. She lives with her husband; her children are married and no longer live with their parents. María has been selling clothing and making tablecloths and covers for five years. She learned this trade from her parents, who were also vendors. From this business, María is able to provide for her household. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy different colored fabrics to make covers and tablecloths, clothing, as well as other merchandise for her business. This will help María to increase her inventory and her earnings. Her aspiration is to strengthen her business and to improve her quality of life, as well as help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making covers and tablecloths.

loans.name: Sikata Group

texts.en:
Sikata Group is a group of 11 farmers in Bungoma South District, represented by Emily. The group has eight women and three men. Emily is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant 0.5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Emily’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to grow enough food for the family and to access the best input prices.

Emily described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Sikata Group members will take input loans of 0.5 acres each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is  taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), noodles, water, and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $50.00  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Sprite, rice, fish, biscuits, Coca-Cola, Fanta, water, and noodles

loans.name: Luttomor

texts.en:
Mr. Luttomor is 55 years old and lives with his wife and son in a 'ger' in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Shurentsetseg, age 54, works at a local market in housekeeping. His son Baasansuren, age 16, goes to local secondary school. 

This borrower has been running his taxi service in town since 2005. He has regular customers in the area and now he is planning to change his car into an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car in order to increase its efficiency. He is now requesting 2,200,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for his taxi service business. He is well-experienced and a hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for his taxi service

loans.name: Joan

texts.fr: est une femme de 38 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 25 ans 5 d'entre eux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail et en gros des vivres frais (légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 17 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter les légumes en gros  pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Joan is a 38-year-old married mother of 8.  Her children's ages vary between 2 and 25 years old, and 5 of them are in school.  She is a merchant and has sold retail and wholesale of fresh food (vegetables), seasonally in the same market place for the past 17 years.  She has a good relationship with suppliers, and most of all, customers that she has acquired over time with her experience in the market.  Still, she finds herself constantly out of stock because she has to sell out in order to buy more stock again, due to her limited capital.  She wants to buy vegetables in bulk to have enough stock to better meet the constant demand of her customers, to avoid stock shortages, and to increase her profits.  She will use her profits not only expand her business, but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables

loans.name: Sandra Liliana

texts.es: Sandra de 43 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 8 a 16 años, ella con su experiencia de 18 años en el mantenimiento y venta de purificadores, hace 8 años logró emprender su propia aventura de negocios,  con el que hoy  genera  sus propios ingresos,  para sostener su hogar. Sus líneas de trabajo son  instalación y comercialización de todo lo relacionado con la purificación  de agua, actualmente es   proveedora de organizaciones importantes en  la hermosa capital de Colombia: “Bogotá”  Sus principales productos son filtros de neveras, purificadores de agua ozono, ultravioleta y carbón activado. En su meta de adquirir una casa trabaja persistentemente,  por eso requiere disminuir los precios de los productos, para ser más competitiva y abordar nuevos mercados, comprando en mayor volumen para obtener mejores descuentos y así mismo más utilidades. Esto es justamente un gran desafío, pues no cuenta con el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo; es así como  acude a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen carbón activado, repuesto para ensamble y purificador. Sandra es muy disciplinada y planea ser más constante en organizar su contabilidad, para poder crecer aun mas y brindar a sus hijos mejores opciones de éxito..
texts.en:
Sandra is 43 years old and the mother of four children between the ages of 8 and 16. She has 18 years of experience working in the maintenance and sales of water filters. Eight years ago, Sandra opened her own business, from which she makes a living and supports her family. Now she works installing and selling everything related to water filters. Currently, she supplies many important organizations in Colombia's beautiful capital, Bogotá. 

Sandra's principle products include filters for freezers, ozone water filters, ultraviolet filters and activated carbon filters. She works persistently in order to reach her goal of acquiring a house. Sandra needs to reduce the prices of her products in order to be more competitive and enter new markets. She plans to buy supplies in larger quantities in order to get discounts and also have a better stock of products. This is quite a challenge for Sandra, since she does not have enough working capital yet. That is why she is requesting her first Kiva loan, which is also her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will use this loan to buy activated carbon in larger quantities and spare parts to assemble purifiers. Sandra is very disciplined and she plans to stay organized in her accounting in order to be able to expand her business and offer her children better opportunities to succeed.

loans.use: to buy activated carbon in larger quantities and spare parts to assemble purifiers.

loans.name: Montserrat Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Montserrat” lo integran 19 emprendedores, sus principales negocios son venta de ropa y alimentos. Pertenecen a la ciudad de Puerto Montt, sur de Chile.
María Alejandra Paredes, en la foto la tercera de derecha a izquierda, viste chaqueta manga corta blanca con flores negras; desde hace 10 años que se dedica al rubro Pastelería; primero aprendió de su familia, posteriormente tomo cursos de repostería y banquetearía. Trabaja desde su casa y en ferias; da a conocer sus productos por afiches e internet.
Compra su mercadería en supermercados mayoristas. 
María Alejandra usó su crédito para abastecerse de ingredientes., tales como harina, huevos, azúcar, esencias, etc.
 Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio y tener una cafetería. 
Lo que más la motiva en seguir con su negocio, es que tiene la seguridad que contará con la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ( créditos, asesoría)
Es casada, tiene una hija de 19 años quien estudia en la universidad.
Nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de Fondo Esperanza es que hay un buen ambiente, cordialidad, buen trato y buenas relaciones.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This group, called “Montserrat”, is composed of 19 members whose principal businesses are selling clothing and food. They live in the city of Puerto Montt, in southern Chile.

Maria Alejandra, in the photo the 3rd from right to left, wearing the short-sleeved jacket with black flowers, has for the last 10 years made and sold pastries. First, she learned from her family, then took courses in baking pastries and banquet preparation. Maria Alejandrina works from home and in market fairs. She advertises her products by flyers and on the internet. She buys her ingredients in wholesale supply stores. Maria Alejandra will use her loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, eggs, sugar, flavorings, etc.

Her dream is to expand her business and to have a coffee shop. What motivates her to continue in business is to have security that she can count on, with the help of Fondo Esperanza through loans and advice. Maria Alejandra is married and has a 19-year-old daughter who studies in the university.

Maria tells us that what she likes most about Fondo Esperanza is its good ambients, cordiality, good treatment, and the good relations that exist there. 

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in region of Los Lagos. One of the attractions of Puerto Montt is its beautiful green landscapes, its little-frequented beaches, its gastronomy and especially its reputation for fish and seafood, and its artisan crafts. It is also the port of entry to the Isla Grande de Chiloe, rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: buy merchandise and ingredients for making pastries.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Umoja Group, located in Bungoma South District, consists of nine women and one man and is led by Elizabeth, pictured on the right with her hand raised. A new One Acre Fund farmer excited for the 2013 Long Rains season, Elizabeth is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Elizabeth managed to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more and plans on using future profits to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Elizabeth’s group members will take input loans for ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, age 46, is married to Shee. She has seven children and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Mwambalazi, Kenya.

Saumu established her own business ten years ago. She sells cereals as retail from her home. Her business is located on the edge of the street, across from her house. In addition to this business, she also sells dumplings from her home. Both businesses are doing well.

She is asking for a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust, so that she can buy more sacks of dry maize, rice, and beans. She will also buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder for making dumplings. She wants to maintain her inventory of products, so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dry maize, rice, and beans and also ingredients to make dumplings.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the town of Mwambalazi. He is very hard-working and is always setting a good example at home since every morning he wakes up with new dreams and desires for prospering. 

Swalehe currently has a small shop where he stocks and sells stationery, especially books. Thanks to God, he has a good customer base because customers like his way of being and of attending to them. He is very happy because every day he is doing well. 

For some time, Swalehe has wanted to expand his only source of work and to have the shop a little better stocked. For this reason, he decided to come to Yehu Microfinance Trust to apply for a loan. With it, he can stock up his shop by buying more books, to offer a variety to his customers. 

He is grateful to all the good-hearted people who want to help him and he promises to repay his loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy more books, to offer a variety to his customers.

loans.name: Uaminifu C Group

texts.en:
Lucy is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Uaminifu C Group members. The ten of them, six women and four men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize,millet and sorghum will be delivered to her on credit . Lucy first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lucy joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Lucy was only able to harvest four bags of maize per one half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest ten bags per one half acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Lucy’s group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim, aged 56 years, acquired a loan amount of 800,000 UGX. He is married, and has ten children who are all in school.

Ephraim trades in goats in the nearby markets, working two days in a week and six hours in a day. He receives additional income as a catechist for the nearby church.

He started his business in 2003 in a rural area. He has been in a position to support his family by providing basic necessities and school fees for the children. He wants money to add to his business since he hopes to rear about 1,000 goats in order to yield a good income. His challenges include tropical diseases that attack the goats.

He is a hardworking and honest person who has been in position to pay his previous loans well. He hopes to expand his business through continued support from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Ndolekho Group

texts.en:
Isaac’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Isaac is pictured on the right of Ndolekho Group with his hand raised. Isaac is pictured amongst the three men and seven women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with millet, sorghum and maize. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Isaac’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to access the best input prices and to improve his farming techniques with the One Acre Fund method.

Isaac managed to harvest six bags of maize on one half acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Isaac’s group will receive five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gjergji

texts.en:
Gjergji is 24 years old and single. He lives in Albania.  Gjergji was born with musical talents and developed the skills later on through the “school of music."  He plays saxophone and clarinet. At 18 when he finished his high school, he started playing musical instruments with a few orchestras in his region. A year later, he selected his own orchestra team.

Gjergji is requesting his second loan for 100,000 Albanian Lek, which he will use to buy a new clarinet since the old one has been damaged. His orchestra team has been invited to play in different activities.

loans.use: to purchase a new clarinet to use in his orchestra.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 35-year-old gentleman who is married to Ruth, a housewife. He is the father of four children, aged 12, 10, and 2 years, and 6 months old. He has been employed in a motorcycle transport business that earns him a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

Solomon has applied for his first loan of KES. 78,504, which will help him purchase a new motorcycle. He hopes to buy a fleet of motorbikes and educate his children with the proceeds.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Uaminifu A Group

texts.en:
Uaminifu A is a group of 10 farmers (9 women and 1 man) in Bungoma South District. Doreen is at the back right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Doreen first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Doreen joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Doreen reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 7 bags per ½ acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to repair her home and perhaps to invest in another business. Doreen’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season, for a total of 5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje, 35 years old, lives with his wife and six children in the rural area of Mwambalazi. Over ten years ago, he decided to open a retail shop in his home. Thanks to effort and hard work, Mwahanje's business has expanded. He now has a steady clientele because of the good and friendly service he provides to his customers. Mwahanje also operates a motorcycle taxi business serving the rural area.

Mwahanje is requesting a loan to purchase a water tank so that he can have fresh water in his home. He will also buy merchandise for his store.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for his home and foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Waaminifu A Group

texts.en:
Agneta is a member of Waaminifu A Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and 1 man. Agneta is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Agneta joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Agneta joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices, hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Agneta described her last year's harvest as poor, but believes she can have a better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps to invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Agneta’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each, for a total of 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is single and has two children. She is involved in food vending, which she has been doing for over 10 years. 

Riziki is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, etc. She is a hard-working woman who loves her work and wants to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Bintrashid

texts.en:
Bintrashid is 33 years old and has three children. She is from Tiribe Mombasa, Kenya.  She has a food stall near her home.

Bintrashid is requesting a loan for 10,000 KES, which she will use to restock her shop with maize and wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar.  She has been able to help her family through her business and has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations. She wants to be able to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to restock her food stall.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 49 years old, married, and has one child.  In 2011, he opened a convenience store to increase his income. It is located in a very good area on the highway, which attracts passers-by and daily visitors. Hassan used to sell sanitary wares, but he changed his business to a daily income business, which covers his family's daily needs.

Hassan is requesting his second loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to increase his merchandise with special canned food and tobacco.  Int the future, he would like to start a wholesale trade.

loans.use: to purchase special canned food and tobacco.

loans.name: Kafene Women Group

texts.en:
Norah, 40 years old, lives in Ntinda, a suburb of Kampala. She is a hairdresser, earning a  daily income to sustain her family of 5 members. Norah's business started in 2000 and she has been able to pay school fees and to provide the necessary needs for both her children and other dependents. She has also built rental houses to earn additional income. 

Norah has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX to complete the tenants' toilet. Her dream is to finish her rentals and to see her family prosper. Norah's main challenges are competition from the neighbors and delay of payments from her customers. She is a hardworking and honest lady and would like to thank the funders for their generosity to the poor.

loans.use: To complete the construction of toilets

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en:
Mwanamina, 36 years old, is from Tiribe, Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has 2 children of school age. Mwanamina owns a vegetable stall business and has a very good customer base. She is very hardworking and an excellent client of the foundation.

Mwanamina is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to expand her business by buying sacks of potatoes and vegetables and employing someone to help provide service to her customers. She is grateful with such opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and to hire an employee

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 28 years old, is married to Maureen and has a one-year-old child. He operates a bakery in Narok, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. John has been advanced a first loan of KES 78,504 which will help him purchase his own oven as he has been using a rented one.

John plans to reinvest the anticipated profits back in the business for expansion. He hopes to grow the business to a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to purchase an oven

loans.name: Nanyingae Ene

texts.en: Nanyingae has successfully repaid her previous loan and used the proceeds to rent an additional portion of land in preparation for the upcoming planting season. She has also diversified to maize and bean farming while her husband takes up the animal trade. Nanyingae hopes to use the increased returns to expand the business and to educate her children. She hopes to grow her business to large scale farming and to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ninaai

texts.en:
Ninaai has successfully paid his first loan and the business is doing well. He has applied for another loan to buy goats and sheep for fattening and to sell later, at a profit. 

Ninaai plans to use the increased proceeds to reinvest in the business and he hopes to grow his business into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, 43 years old, is from Tiribe, Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has six children. Mwanamisi operates a fruits and vegetables stall business. She sells from her stall near her home. Mwanamisi says that she has been able to help her family and to pay school fees for her children through her business and that she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations.

Mwanamisi wants to be able to continue working and helping her family. She is asking for this loan of KES 20,000 to help expand her business by buying fruits and vegetables to continue working and offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to help expand her business by buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is married and has 2 children. She describes herself as a disciplined woman. Pamela operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Pamela will use this KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members. Pamela's business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM, having successfully repaid a loan of KES 80,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mwashasha

texts.en:
Mwashasha, 46 years old, is married to Mwero. They have one grown son who has completed his studies. Mwashasha came up with the idea to open her own business. With her husband's help, she has sold fish from her home for the last four years. Mwashasha has several customers. Later on, she would like to buy her own fish depot where she can generate good sales.

Mwashasha is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of more stocks of fish and cooking oil and a bigger frying pan.

loans.use: to purchase of more stocks of fish and cooking oil and a bigger frying pan.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 49-year-old, married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be a social and talkative man. 

He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Joseph will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by his family members. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is Joseph's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for his family.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Joy’s group has ten farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Joy is pictured on the right of Upendo Group with her hand raised. She is pictured amongst the one man and nine women of her group. 

Joy will receive input loans capable of planting ½ acre with millet, sorghum, and maize. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Joy’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to access the best input prices.

Last year, Joy harvested 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and invest in a new cow. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Joy’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Luvsandorj

texts.en: Mr. Luvsandorj, 36 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. His wife, Sarantuya, helps him run his wooden furniture manufacturing business and attends a specialty training school. His daughter, Uyanga, age 10, goes to the local school and Ariunsan, age 3, goes to a local kindergarten. Luvsandorj has been running his wooden furniture manufacturing business for 10 years. He is now requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to pay for his wife's tuition fees. He and his wife are both hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's tuition fees

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija, 50 years old, is widowed and lives with her four children. She sells charcoal at the market in order to provide a better life for her children. The business is located at a strategic point along a very well-traveled street, which is good for Khadija's sales.

Khadija is asking Yehu for a loan so that she can take advantage of the high demand for this commodity at this time. She will use the money to buy charcoal in quantity to enable her to improve her sales and her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: La Huerta Group

texts.es: "La Huerta" es un grupo que tiene varios ciclos trabajando con VisionFund y KIVA los integrantes del grupo son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables lo que los caracteriza es su alegría y la muy buena amistad que hay entre ellos platican que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron “Porque antes si nos reuníamos en una huerta grandísima donde había muchos frutos, como manzanas, peras, higos, limones, etc. Pero ahora miren en donde estamos" Los integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidos y contentos, con Vision Fund y Kiva ya que ellos podrán invertir en sus actividades como Doña Reyna invertirá en colchas y cobijas, Doña Petra, Alma Jazmín invertirán en artesanías, Ángela invertirá en pintado de servilletas y, finalmente, Doña Victoria invertirá en sus borregas. Don Francisco quien también forma parte del grupo cuenta que tiene 35 años de edad está casado con la señora Isabel desde hace 15 años juntos han formado una familia con 2 niños que se encuentran estudiando. Don Francisco tiene un negocio de joyería el se dedica a la venta de joyería como aretes, pulseras, arracadas, cadenitas, relojes, esclavas. Él hace las reparaciones en su mismo negocio de joyería vende playeras deportivas, peluches, regalos etc. Platica que inició su negocio desde hace cinco años y que la inició porque un día su esposa soñó que vendían oro, fue como un día en un viaje a Zitacuaro compraron oro y su esposa lo ofrecía entre sus amistades y amigos como vieron que funcionaba muy bien Don Francisco también decidió poner su joyería anteriormente era gerente una gasolinera platica que le gustaba mucho su trabajo solo que el horario estaba muy pesado incluso los fines de semana se veía forzado a trabajar esto le afectaba su vida familiar con sus hijos y esposa ya que casi no los veía. Don Francisco cuenta que con su liquidación le alcanzo para poner su joyería en un pequeño local inicio vendiendo solo dos charolas de joyería con el tiempo mejoro mucho porque aprendió hacer reparaciones, y ahora le va muy bien Don Francisco está muy contento con su negocio “Ahora con mi joyería llevo una vida más tranquila sin presiones, puedo manejar mis horarios y estar el mayor tiempo con ellos (su familia) incluso puedo salir a pasear los fines de semana lo que antes no era posible por mi trabajo. Puedo abrir y cerrar a la hora que yo quiera". Don Francisco no presenta ninguna dificultad con su negocio incluso le da trabajo a una empleada quien le ayuda a atender el negocio. Su meta es que su negocio crezca y obtener mejores ganancias para vivir una mejor calidad de vida sin embargo lo que mas importante para Don Francisco es que sus hijos terminen una carrera "...para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida que la mía".
texts.en:
La Huerta is a group that has worked with VisionFund and Kiva for several cycles.  The group members are very hardworking and responsible people characterized by their happiness and their good friendships with each other.  They say they chose the name of their group "because we used to meet in a huge garden where there was a lot of fruit, such as apples, pears, figs, lemons, etc.  But look where we are now."

The members of the group are very grateful to and happy about VisionFund and Kiva because they'll be able to invest in their jobs.  Reyna will buy bedspreads and blankets, Petra and Alma Jazmín will buy crafts, Ángela will invest in painting napkins, and, finally, Victoria will invest in her sheep.

Francisco, who's also part of the group, says he's 35 years old and has been married to Isabel for 15 years.  Together they formed a family with two children who are students.  Francisco has a jewelry business.  He makes a living selling jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, pendant earrings, chains, watches, and bangles.  He makes repairs in the same jewelry business.  He sells athletic t-shirts, stuffed toys, gifts, etc.

He says he started his business five years ago because one day his wife dreamed they were selling gold.  One day when they were on a trip to Zitacuaro they bought gold and his wife sold it to her friends, and they saw that it worked out well so Francisco decided to set up a jewelry shop.  Previously he was the manager of a gas station.  He says he liked his job a lot but that the schedule was difficult; he even had to work on the weekends.  This affected his family life with his children and his wife because he hardly saw them.

Francisco says that with his severance pay he had the money to set up a small shop where he began selling with only two trays of jewelry.  In time it improved a lot because he learned to do repairs, and now it's going very well for him.  Francisco's very happy with his business: "Now, with my jewelry shop, I lead a much more peaceful life without stress.  I can manage my schedule and spend the majority of my time with them (his family).  I can even go out on the weekend, which wasn't possible before because of my job.  I can open and close whenever I want."

Francisco has no problems with his business.  He even gives a job to one employee who helps him tend to the business.  His goal is for his business to grow and to get better earnings to live a better quality of life.  What is most important for Francisco, though, is for his children to finish their professional studies "so they have a better quality of life than mine."

loans.use: to buy jewelry and gifts

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance, a resident of Mariakani, Kenya, is a married mother of two children. She runs a food cafe which has been in operation for four years. Constance was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc. Constance's challenge has been price fluctuations. She is aware of the potential for growth to a hotel/restaurant. Constance believes she can save the extra income from the proceeds of this loan for her children's education and to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and 32 years old. She is from Tiribe, a coastal town in Kenya, where she lives with her five children. She owns a fish stall, where she she sells dried fish. She buys fish in large quantity, and at wholesale price, from the fishermen, themselves. She resells to consumers in small amounts, at a fair retail price.

Tiribe, being a coastal town, has many people who are consumers of fish. She has sold dried fish for a period of two years, and she has been able to widen her customer base, through good relationships. Now, she has approached us (Yehu) for a loan amounting to KES 10,000 to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of fish.

loans.use: to expand her business, by buying a larger quantity of fish to resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old, married, and has six children. She lives with her husband in the rural part of Mwambalazi, Coast province.

Mariam has a grocery store. She loves her job, since it gives her ample time to socialize with her family members. The challenge that Mariam faces in her business is the high prices of commodities. 

She is requesting this loan to buy oil, rice, sugar, soap and instant foods. With the help of this loan, she will be able to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, soap and instant foods, to resell in her store

loans.name: Sadar Jaya Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four women and one man who all live in the same village and who all buy and sell wedding and cemetery products. They have plenty of experience; several of them have been in the business more than five years.

Agus (who is the man holding the brown envelope) is the group's president. He is 35 years old, married, and a father of three children. All of his children are going to school. 

Agus will use the loan to buy some kinds of flowers: roses, orchids, and tuberose flowers from the flower market in the city. He will then resell his goods at the local market, where he has a stand, to welcome Chinese New Year. He also has skills to arrange the flowers. He is self-taught in floral arrangement. He can save his profit of IDR 200,000 per month.

Agus has five years of experience in this line of business. He works actively to help cover his family's daily expenses. He has a dream to have a permanent stand in the market and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy some kinds of flowers: roses, orchids, and tuberose flowers for Chinese New Year.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself as an ambitious and focused woman. She operates a retail store, where she sells household items such as sugar, bread, sodas, salt, and maize flour. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. Her business goal is to expand her business and run a new grocery store, within five years.

She will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank, for use by her family members. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM, and she managed to repay a previous loan of KES 40,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank, for use by her family.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a 54-year-old, married woman. She has four children, whose ages range from 25 to 33 years. She describes herself as a focused and determined woman. She operates a retail store, where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, and maize flour. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business.

She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used to store water for selling to the community. Her business goal is to start a new business of selling water to her community, within five years.

This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. She has previously taken a loan of KES 80,000, which she managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank, which she will use to start a new business of selling water to her community.

loans.name: Altamirano Group

texts.es: El grupo “Altamirano” está integrado por ocho personas todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras es un grupo que le gusta convivir lo que las caracteriza es la gran amistad que hay entre ellas. Platican las integrantes del grupo que ellas mismas eligieron el nombre porque donde inicio el grupo y en donde reunían se encontraba una granja de animales el nombre de la granja era "Altamirano". Doña Elvira quien forma parte del grupo platica que tiene 44 años de edad está casada con el señor Delfino quien trabaja en el campo desde hace 25 años juntos formaron una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son aun dependientes que se encuentran estudiando. Doña Elvira se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace 20 años, inicio su actividad porque quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que en ese tiempo sus cinco hijos eran muy pequeños y los gastos eran demasiados entonces fue como Doña Elvira se vio motivada a iniciar con la crianza de sus borregos. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito a la institución para comprar 2 borregos mas y la pastura Doña Elvira compra los animales pequeños para criarlos crecerlos grandes y fuertes y vernderlos más adelante. Comenta que muchas veces en la temporada de fiestas, bodas, bautizos, etc van a su casa a comprarle sus borregos. Ella comento “Me gusta mucho cuando mis borregas dan a luz sus corderitos para mi es una satisfacción muy grande porque veo como van avanzando mi ganado”  solo que su única dificultad es la falta de un buen corral ya que si el sus borregos enferman y llegan a morir para Doña Elvira esto representa la pérdida total de su ganancias y de su inverción. La meta de Doña Elvira es poder llegar a tener más borregos y cerdos para que sus ganancias  aumenten y poder solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos que aun se encuentran estudiando para que ellos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo son María Isabel, Patricia, Jessica, Ma Albertha ellas invertirán en la compra de cerdos para cría y venta, Doña Teresa, María Eva invertirán en la compra y engorda de borregos para su venta, finalmente Anayely invertirá en pollos para cría y venta ellas están muy agradecidas con Vision Fund y KIVA por el crédito otorgado para ellas será de gran ayuda para impulsar su negocio.
texts.en: The group Altamirano is made up of 8 people all of whom are very hard working women. It is a group that like to live characterized by the great friendship that is between them. The members of the group talked among each other and chose the name because of where the group began and where they met, on a farm with the name Altamirano". Elvira, a member of the group, is 44 years old, and is married to Delfino who works in the fields. They started a family 25 years ago with 5 children of whom 2 are still dependents who are studying. Elvira raises sheep for a living, and has done so for 20 years. She began her job because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. At that time her 5 children were very young and the expenses were great. It was for this reason and Elvira became motivated to begin raising lambs. She is currently requested a loan from the institution to purchase 2 lambs and pasture. Elvira buys small animals to raise, grow large and strong, and then sell them. She says that many times in the season of parties, weddings, baptisms, etc. they go to her home to purchase the lambs. She says, "I like very much when my sheep give birth to their lambs. For me it is a big satisfaction because I see the lambs grow." Her only difficulty is her lack of a good shed and  and her lambs get sick and die and for Elvira this represents a loss of earning and her investment. Elvira's goal is to be able to have more lambs and pigs to raise and sell, and to increase her income to cover the costs of her children's education so that they can have a better quality of life. Team members are María Isabel, Patricia, Jessica, Ma Albertha will invest in buying and selling pigs for breeding. Teresa and María Eva will invest in the purchase and raising of lambs to sell. Finally Anayely will invest in chickens to raise and sell. They are all very grateful to Vision Fund and Kiva for the loan offered to them. It will be a great help to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy sheep and pasture.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy milk in larger quantity, for a milk- and yogurt-selling business

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru:
Икромчон 35 - летний женатый мужчина проживающий в городе Турсунзаде. Он живет с женой. Икромчон является отцом троих детей. Жена Икромчона занимается бизнесом. 
Икромчон занимается ремонтом холодильников. У него имеется собственная мастерская. В этой области он восемь лет. Также на сегодняшний день Икромчон открыл автомойку, который еще полностью недостроенный. Икромчон берет кредит чтобы продолжить ремонт (приобретения стройматериалов), а также приобрести необходимые оборудования.
texts.en:
Ikromjon is thirty-five years old, married and lives in the city of Tursun-zoda with his wife and three children. His wife is a businesswoman. 
For eight years Ikromjon has made a living by repairing refrigerators in his personal workshop. Recently, he has also opened an car wash which isn't yet fully operational. Therefore, he's asking for a loan in order to purchase some building materials and equipment he requires to continue construction.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction materials and equipment.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 9 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be a humble and determined woman.

Irine operates a retail store and grocery stand where she sells household items and vegetables. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Irine will use the Kes 15,600 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her family members. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of Kes 30,000, which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es: Don Félix tiene 35 años, él es originario de San Felipe de los Alzati un lugar lleno de riqueza natural en sus cerros que están llenos de oyameles y donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican al cultivo de flor de noche buena. Es un lugar donde las tierras son proliferas para el cultivo de aguacate, don Félix platica que es el segundo crédito que pide con su grupo llamado Girasol, dice que él desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica al cultivo y venta de frutos de temporada él dice “empecé vendiendo aguacates y como vi que me estaba yendo bien en la venta decidí ampliar mi negocio y surtir fruta de temporada ahorita comprare con el nuevo crédito sandias, jícamas, naranjas, mandarinas,  melón chino y verde y aguacate”. Dice que parte de su fruta la compra en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro una población cercana a la de él, y va y la vende en los tianguis del estado de México y en diferentes localidades en su camioneta que tiene. Dice que su sueño es comprar un terreno donde pueda poner un negocio estable y así estar mas al pendiente de su familia ya que tiene un niño en la primaria. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman María, Jose, y Agustina todos ellos invertirán en frutas y legumbres de temporada para vender en diferentes tianguis del estado de México.
texts.en:
Félix is 35 years old. He is from San Felipe de los Alzati, a place that is rich with natural wealth, with hills full of Sacred Fir trees and where most people work growing poinsettia plants. In this region the land is perfect for growing avocados. 

Félix comments that this is the second loan that he has requested with his group, which is called Girasol (“sunflower”). He says that he has been growing and selling seasonal produce for more than 10 years. He says that he “started selling avocados and I saw that the sales were going well, so I decided to expand my business and to stock seasonal fruit. Now with the new loan I will buy watermelons, yam beans, oranges, mandarin oranges, cantaloupe and honeydew melons and avocados”. 

He says that he will buy part of the fruit from the central wholesale market Zitacuaro, a nearby town. He will sell the fruit in the open air markets in México state and using the van he owns he will also sell in other towns. He says that his dream is to buy a piece of land where he can establish a stable business and in that way have more time with his family as he has a child in primary school. The other members of the group are called María, Jose and Agustina. They will all invest in seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell at the open air markers in México state.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, yam beans, oranges, mandarin organes, cantaloupe and honeydew melons and avocados.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Likoni area of the Coast Province in Kenya. She is married and has two school-aged children. She owns a green grocer which she has been operating for five years. She sells tomatoes, sugar, onions and other products.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and the high costs of transporting her goods. 

Hellen is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables and fruits in wholesale. She will invest the extra income from the loan towards becoming a major supplier of groceries in the area.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits in wholesale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 34-year-old divorced mother of four children. She is from Tiribe, Kenya and has a fruits and vegetables stall business. She sells from her stall near her home.

She has been able to help her family through her business and she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations. Beatrice wants to be able to continue working and helping her family, so she is asking for a loan of 50,000 KES to expand her business and buy fruits and vegetables to continue working and offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Magalis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Magalis de 24 años de edad, originaria  de Granada, acompañada, madre de 1 hijo de 3 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de fritos (unas de las comidas más típica de la ciudad), de la que es propietaria hace más de 1 año. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven trabajando con su mama en la venta de verduras, pero luego la mama decidí viajar a Costa Rica, buscando un mejor nivel de vida económico para su familia, la cual dejo de vender verduras. Con el tiempo ella se casó y fue allí que decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de fritos, se siente muy satisfecha porque este negocio le genera ganancias a diarias, cuenta con clientes fijos, sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio.
Ella   está solicitando el financiamiento para compra carne, maseca, cebolla, papa, etc. ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar  todo la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus deliciosos fritos, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias y poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Magalis, 24, is from Granada.  She's married and the mother of one child, age 3.  She's a merchant and makes a living selling "fritos" (some of the most traditional dishes in the city), a business she has owned for more than a year.

She started in business when she was very young, working with her mother selling vegetables.  Later her mother decided to go to Costa Rica in search of a better standard of living for her family, so she stopped selling vegetables.  In time she got married and decided to set up her own business selling fritos.  She's very satisfied because this business generates daily profits for her and she has steady customers.  Her expectation is to make her business grow.

She's requesting the loan to buy meat, Maseca [a brand of flour], onions, potatoes, etc.  She thinks the loan will help her buy all the ingredients she needs to make her delicious fritos.  Her goal is to increase her sales to get better profits and be able to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Tam-Tamnesu Group

texts.en:
Mariama (who is pictured second from left) is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariama, age 36, is married to a businessman and the couple has four children – one in primary school and three in secondary schools. Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market food – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, salt, etc. This is the first loan that Mariama and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mariama will use her share of the loan to expand her business. 

(Also including in the left of the photo is loan officer Joseph, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, pepper, salt and other goods in wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman. She describes herself to be warm, jovial and a customer-friendly woman. She operates a grocery store  where she sells items such as pumpkin, paw paw, onions, kale, mangoes, etc. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Rosalia will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to run a  new retail shop  within five years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of Kes 20,000 which she managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a rental houses business where she provides housing accommodation. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members and tenants. Her business goal is to purchase another plot of land and build more rental houses within five years. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of Kes 40,000 which she managed to repay successfully .

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Marium

texts.en: Marium is a 45-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from four years to 29 years. She describes herself as an honest and hard working woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as onions and tomatoes. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the 15600 KES loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her seven family members. Her goal is to run a new business of selling water to her community within five years. Previously, Marium took a loan of 20,000 KES which she successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 45-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working in the transportation business for 14 years. He is well known in the region for his good reputation and hard work.

Khodor is applying for his tenth loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to register the land he bought with a previous loan to start an agricultural business. His previous loans helped him a lot in improving his business through buying necessary transportation and agricultural tools and machines. 

He is planning to start the agricultural business to increase his income and improve his living. Khodor hopes to keep on expanding his business and developing his working habits. 

Khodor also owns a tractor, which he uses to fix other people's land in order to plant new seeds or small trees.To support his family, Khodor runs several businesses. In addition to driving his tractor, he bakes Markouk bread and sells it to a few shops and individuals who request continuously from him. He also works at harvesting olives for olive tree owners during the harvest season.

loans.use: to register land he owns to start an agricultural business.

loans.name: Korkrie Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Mohamed was born in Northern Sierra Leone 32 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. The other is not of school-going age.  Mohamed sells a wide variety of items including: biscuits, cigarettes, toothpaste, soap, milk, sugar, drinks, etc.  He has been a businessman for nine years now. 

With the help of this loan, Mohamed and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mohamed will use his share of the loan to buy the above-mentioned items in larger quantity to add to his current inventory.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, cigarettes, toothpaste, soap, milk, sugar, drinks, etc. in larger quantity to add to his current inventory

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim lives in rural Lyantonde with his wife and seven children. He rears cows and grows beans, maize and coffee to get income to sustain his family's needs. He plans to buy more cows with the loan. These he will keep on the farm and they will come in handy in case of emergencies and paying tuition for his children. The major challenges are cattle diseases. He is a hard working and honest citizen.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an over-locker and joki machine for her embroidery and sewing business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as focused and jovial. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

She will use the 21,000 KES loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her five family members for household chores. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM after receiving a loan of 20,000 KES which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, dishes, spoons, buckets, plates and other goods to sell in his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy body lotions, toothbrushes, soaps, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is from Tiribe, Kenya. She is applying for this loan for the fourth time after successfully paying her first loan as a scrap metal dealer. Agnes is the owner of a scrap store where she has been working for many years. She says that she is making headway with the business, attracting a good number of customers due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked store.

She is a very enthusiastic person and wants to keep growing and investing in this business so that she can help with the household expenses.
Agnes is requesting a loan to expand her business territory and to travel to rural homes. She hopes to buy scrap metals at a cheaper price to widen her profit margin. She hopes to continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and other beauty items for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate, a single mother, operates a retail shop in the outskirts of Lyantonde town. She started the business to earn income to provide for the basic needs of her child and herself. She wants the loan to buy sodas and beers, which are her major stock items, and pineapples which are in season and can be bought cheaply. She will make the loan repayments from the profits of the business. She is a resilient hard-working woman.

loans.use: To buy sodas, beers and fruits to sell in her business

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a new customer in this institution. He is single, aged 30 and planning to marry very soon. He is a carpenter and in the evening he uses a motorcycle to transport people so as to make extra income. He works six days a week and it is because of this hard work that he has been able to purchase land and start construction on a house. The purpose of this loan is to finish his house, part of it is for his domestic use and another part will be used for his business to generate income to service this loan. His biggest customers are local schools that order desks and the local people from his village. Martin started this business back in 2001 to improve his living standards, the same dream he still harbors. His future plan is to expand this business, and to bring as many youths who have that talent to exercise them and showcase their skills and abilities. This will in turn create jobs for many, and develop him and the country at large. In spite of this, Martin faces challenges in the cost of materials and limited capital but since he is an honest and hardworking fellow, these problems won't be permanent. In the photo is Martin, his future wife and the Ugafode staff member (left to right).

loans.use: to complete his house.

loans.name: Familia Toribio Group

texts.es: El grupo "Familia Toribio" esta integrada por solo tres personas dos mujeres y un hombre ellos son familiares y viven en una comunidad donde las personas se caracterizan por ser personas muy trabajadoras y responsables. Gaby es uno de los integrantes, paltica que tiene 37 años de edad es una mujer casada desde hace 21 años con su esposo Lucio juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando y su pequeña que aun no va a la escuela, Gaby es una persona muy trabajadora ellas se dedica a la elaboracion de tortillas pero tambien atiende la tienda de abarrotes que su Hermana Magaly le traspaso, cuenta que esta vez esta solicitando el credito a la institucion para comprar maiz y productos como pan, huevo, leche, refrescos, azucar, etc. Para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes en la elaboracion de tortillas lleva ya un año y la tienda lleva el mismo tiempo platica que quiso iniciar con la elaboracion de sus tortillas porque quiso apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar Gaby comento "Me gusta mucha mi negocio y más cuando hay ganacias solo que en esta temporaba me ha ido un poco mal ya que en estos tiempos las personas tienen maiz que cosecharon a finales del años asi que en esta temporada no me ira muy bien en las ganacias de la venta de las tortillas,aunque solo es un tiempo porque a mediados de años las personas se quedan sin maiz y es como empiezan a comprar tortillas pero trabajare mas duro en la tienda para recuperarme en cuanto a ganancias" La Meta de Gaby es llegar a tener mas clientes para que sus ganacias aumenten para poder ofecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida asi como Gaby tiene sueños tambien los otros integrantes del grupo estakn solicitando credito para invertirle a sus negocion Como Doña María invertira en la venta de tortillas y verduras y Luis Enrique en la tienda de abarrotes ellos estan muy agradecidos y contentos por el apoyo atorgado por parte de lainstitucion y KIVA.
texts.en:
There are only three members in the 'Familia Toribio' [Toribio Family] group - two women and a man. They are relatives and they live in a community where the people are characterized by being very hard-working and responsible. 

Gaby is one of the members. She tells us she is 37 years old and has been married to her husband Lucio since she was 21. Together they have three children. Two of them are studying and the youngest doesn't go to school yet. 

Gaby is a very hard-working person. She works making tortillas but also looks after the grocery shop that her sister Magaly has passed on to her.
