Sary is 55 years old, and lives with his wife and seven children in a village, in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province. Two of his children are still of school age, and Sary looks after them. 

Sary and his wife are rice farmers, and they supplement their family’s income by working for others farmers. They have been doing this for seven years, earning about 22,000 Cambodian Riels (KHR) per day to feed the family. 

Sary has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles, while the other member of the loan group is new this cycle. Sary managed to completely pay back his past loans, which have helped him to better support his family with enough food. Now, he is leading this group of two to request a new loan. Sary will use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow healthy and profitable rice, so he can improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy, 42, is married with seven dependent children, four of whom are still in school. His family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main sources of his family’s income are from farming rice and catching fish in his village, while his wife is a fish seller to better support the family. Dy has been running his business for 10 years, earning about 34,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and he is able to save about 19,000 KHR each day.
 
Dy received his first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, five loan cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain his family’s business and support his family’s needs. With a good business, he is now applying for another loan of 1,500,000 KHR to pay for the labor fees in harvesting rice and to buy fish to resell. He hopes to increase the income from his current business so as to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees in harvesting rice.

loans.name: Kelly Edith

texts.es:
La socia  Kelly Edith se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,la socia brinda servicio de carga,la aocia lleva verduras como cebollas,zanahorias y tomates y tambien frutas como manzana,naranja y platanos,la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como puerto maldonado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es comprar un carro nuevo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar manzanas,naranjas y platanos y tambien comprar cebollas,zanahorias y tomates.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Kelly Edith is still working in cargo transportation. She transports vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes, and also fruit such as apples, oranges and banans. She transports this merchandise to different cities such as Puerto Maldonado. She works from 8:00 a.m to 7:00 p.m.

Her dream is to buy a new car. She is requesting the loan to buy apples, oranges, bananas, onions, carrots and tomatoes. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, bananas, onions, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal is 64 years old and lives with her husband and six children in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district. Out of all her children, she still has one child who is still in school. Selling snacks is the main source of her family’s income while her husband has been working for others for a fee for about thirty-five years. Her business earns her family a daily income of about 58,000 KHR, but she is able to save 13,000 KHR each day.

Sophal has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already while the other members have been with VisionFund for three or four cycles. Sophal has successfully used the previous loans to better support her family with enough food. She is now leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy snacks to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy snacks to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia tiene 36 años y vive al norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba, está casada con Zenón y tienen tres hijos en edad escolar ella trabaja en el área de prestación de servicios realizando limpieza en un edificio de departamentos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja medio día, el esposo trabaja con movilidad prestando servicios de taxi en la zona norte de esta misma ciudad, son trabajadores, tienen una pequeña fracción de terreno en la casa de los padres de la señora y ahí viven en dos ambientes y quieren ampliar su pequeña vivienda que consta de dos habitaciones y baño y que actualmente es muy reducida para una familia de cinco personas que conforman la familia que ellos constituyen, de esta manera están construyendo dos habitaciones para sus hijos y les faltan recursos para los pisos, techo y revoques, de esta manera mejorarán en parte sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Julia is 36, and lives on the north side of Cochabamba. She is married to Zenón and they have three school-age children. She works half-days as a cleaner in an apartment building in the city of Cochabamba. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the northern area of the same city. They are hard-working. 

They have a small piece of land at her parents' place, and live there in two rooms. They want to expand their small house, which consists of two rooms and a bathroom, and which is now very small for their family of five people. 

So they are building two rooms for their children, and need funds for the floors, roof and plastering. In this way they will partially improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her house.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary is fifty years old, and lives in a rural area in the Ek Phnom district of the Battambang province. She has five children in total, one of whom is still in school and is dependent on Nary.  

Nary has been selling grocery items to support her family for the past twenty-eight years. She has already completed four loan cycles with VisionFund, while the other member of the loan group has completed one. Nary managed to completely pay back her past loans, which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihoods. Now, she is the leader for this loan group.  She is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. With this loan, she hopes to further increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron is a 56-year-old widow with two children.  She lives in a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has been involved in buying and selling fishes in the local area, and she also raises pigs to earn additional income for her family. She has been in this business for 15 years, earning about 42,000 Cambodian Riels (KHR) per day, and she is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

Saron’s group consists of two members who have both been with VisionFund for two cycles. Saron completely repaid the loans which have helped her to better support her current business. Now, she is leading her group to ask for another loan of 1,400,000 KHR each.  Saron is mainly going to use her portion to buy fishes for resale, but will also use some of it to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fishes for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha es soltera, desde hace 10 años, radica en el trópico de Cochabamba, en el municipio de Entre Rios. La Sra. Martha es de la provincia Ichilo del departamento de Santa Cruz, uno de los lugares más pobres de Bolivia, vino de su comunidad de Puerto Avaroa, Ichilo como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida,  debido a que la producción bajó por los cambios climatológicos, que son difíciles de controlar, por lo que decidió ir al trópico, y en el transcurso del tiempo, con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo se compró su lote agrícola, en la que hoy en día trabaja en el sector agrícola. El crédito que está solicitando es para ampliación de mandarina  de  esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida también ha estado siempre colaborando en su sindicato que realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en: Martha is single and has lived in the Tropic of Cochabamba for the last 10 years, in the town of Entre Rios. Martha is from the Ichilo province in the department of Santa Cruz, one of the poorest places in Bolivia. Like the majority of people, she left her community in Puerto Avaroa, Ichilo in search of better life opportunities because production had fallen as a result of climate change which is difficult to control. This is why she decided to move to the Tropic, and in time, with a great deal of work and effort, she bought a plot of farmland where she now works in agriculture. The loan she is requesting is to expand her mandarin crop so that she can improve her standard of living. She has also been working constantly with the union which represents her economic activity.

loans.use: to increase mandarin production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Petruska Dolor

texts.es: La Sra. Petruska madre de 2 hijas, por la necesidad de mantener a su familia, vio por conveniente abrir una tienda de barrio, hace 4 años que tiene esta actividad la misma que en todo este tiempo le dio la oportunidad de conocer sobre precios, sobre artículos de venta, lugares para proveerse de los mismos, como también clientes y proveedores.  Gracias a sus familiares es que logro abastecer su negocio, con préstamos pequeños, sin embargo en este tiempo vio que dentro de sus ganancias también tiene un margen para sus ahorros, por lo que desea obtener el crédito para abastecer mejor la tienda y tener mejores ganancias y con el tiempo ahorrar para un anticrético. Actualmente vive en casa de familiares, quienes por las niñas le dieron cobijo. Pero a medida que las niñas crecen necesitan  mayor espacio. La Sra. Petruska también elabora masitas y pan casero, el mismo que también tiene gran acogida por los vecinos del lugar. Ella dice que día a día tiene que levantarse muy temprano para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, pues además hay una tienda muy próxima con la cual tiene bastante competencia. Entonces ella ve que si la otra tienda no abre, ella tiene mayores oportunidades para sus ventas.
texts.en: Señora Petruska is the mother of two daughters. Because of the need to support her family, she found it convenient to open a neighborhood store. She has had this business for four years, and this time has given her the opportunity to know about prices and which items to sell and where to obtain them, as well as customers and suppliers. Thanks to her relatives, she managed to stock her business using small loans. Nevertheless, she now sees that within her earnings she also has a margin for her savings, and for this reason she wants to obtain a loan to stock the store better and have better earnings, and with time save for an anticrético [a Bolivian rental agreement in which the rent is paid up front]. She now lives in the house of relatives who gave her shelter for her daughters, but as the girls grow, they will need more space. Señora Petruska also makes pastries and homemade bread, which are also greatly sought after by her neighbors. She says that every day she has to get up very early to satisfy the needs of her customers, since there is also a store very close by with which she has quite a bit of competition, so she sees that if the other store is not open, she has better opportunities for her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ivo Luigy

texts.es: El señor Ivo tiene 47 años, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, terminó el colegio y estaba estudiando en la universidad, iba en el tercer año pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos ya que falleció el padre a causa de una enfermedad, solo termino a nivel técnico. Actualmente vive en la zona Central del departamento de Cochabamba - Bolivia, en la misma casa de su madre a la cual le mantiene y está a su cuidado. El solicitante trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano como propietario, tiene 6 años de experiencia, trabaja de lunes a domingo, en diferentes horarios del día, su principal gasto es el pago de combustible y mantenimiento del vehículo. Actualmente el cliente y su madre solamente cuentan con dos cuartos y una cocina pequeña, por lo cual solicitan el crédito para ampliar su vivienda para tener una mayor comodidad para ambos.
texts.en:
Ivo, age 47, is single.  He does not have a life partner, children, or dependents.  He completed school and was studying at the university.  He was in his third year, but he did not manage to finish due to lack of financial resources.  His father died from an illness, so he only completed the technical level.  

He currently lives in the Zona Central in the Cochabamba department in Bolivia.  He lives in the same house as his mother.  He supports her and takes care of her.

He works as an owner in the urban transportion business.  He works from Mondays to Sundays on different daily schedules.  His main expense is paying for fuel and vehicle maintenance.

At the present time he and his mother only have two rooms and a small kitchen.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to expand his house in order to to make them both more comfortable.

loans.use: to expand his house.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia Karina se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes,la socia vende paquetes turisticos a diferentes lugares como valle sagrado,machupicchu entre otros lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar de boletos turisticos.


La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Karina is still working in the travel agency business selling tourism packages to the Sacred Valley, Machu Picchu etc. She works from 8 am to 7 pm. The agency has been open for eight years now, and all is going well. Karina’s dream is to expand it.

She is grateful for the help that has been given to her and promises to make the loan repayments in a disciplined manner. The money will be used to buy tourist entry tickets.

loans.use: buy tourist entry tickets.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La socia Rosalbina se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayubos,almuerzos y ceaas,la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno,estofado de carne y sopas,la socia lleva un buen tiempo en su trabajo y le muy bien,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosalbina continues to work in the restaurant business. She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners, cooking dishes such as roast chicken, meat stew and soups. She has been doing this work for a long time and things are going well for her. In her free time, Rosalbina likes to go for walks. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is requesting the loan to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables. 

Rosalbina is happy about the loan and committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Jessica Belinda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de lavanderia,la socia lava ternos y vestidos,la socia ya tiene 6 años trabajando y le va muy bien,la socia y tambien esta estudiando ingles,la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es terminar de estudiar ingles.La socia solicita el credito para terminar de estudiar ingles.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues working in the laundry business. She washes suits and dresses. She has already been working for six years, and it is going very well for her. She is also studying English. She wants to get ahead. Her dream is to finish her English studies. She is applying for the loan to finish her studies of English.

She is grateful for the support that is offered to her, and furthermore she promises to make her loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to finish her English studies.

loans.name: Luz America

texts.es:
La socia Luz America se dedica al negocio de servicio de niñeras,lavanderas entre otros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de servicio de niñera.La socia solicita el credito para comprar unas sillas y escritorio para implementar su oficina de prestar servicio de niñeras.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz America has a business providing nannies and laundresses. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has been in this business for seven years now, and it is going very well. 

Her dream is to expand her nanny business. She is applying for the loan to buy some chairs and a desk for her office. She is happy about the loan she has been granted, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy some chairs and a desk for her nanny business.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
La socia Maria Soledad se dedica al negocio de venta de desayunos como quinua con leche,maca y mates,la socia vende en forms ambulatoria,ella tiene una carreta donde vende los desayunos y en la tarde la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de salchipapas que es un plato a base de papas y salchichas,ella tambien vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia ya tiene 7 años en estos pequeños negocios,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papas,salchichas,quinua y leche.


La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Maria Soledad's business is selling breakfasts such as quinoa with milk, maca (a Peruvian root vegetable), and teas. She sells as a street vendor. She has a cart where she sells breakfasts, and in the afternoon she works at her business of selling salchipapas, which is a dish based on potatoes and sausage, which she also sells as a street vendor. She has had these little businesses for 7 years already. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is applying for a loan to buy potatoes, sausages, quinoa, and milk.

She is happy with the loan offered and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sausages, quinoa, and milk to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende ropa para damas,caballeros y niños,la socia se dedica a este negocio 7 años y le va muuy bien,la socia tiene un stand en un centro comercial,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,chompas,casacas y polos para niños,damas y caballeros.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The borrower still has her business selling clothing. She sells clothing for ladies, men and children, and has been working in this business for seven years. It is going very well.

She has a stand in a shopping center, and works from 8:00am to 7:00pm. Her dream is to expand her clothes-selling business. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy pants, sweaters, jackets and T-shirts for children, ladies and men. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy pants, sweaters, jackets and T-shirts for children, ladies and men.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La socia Mary luz se dedica al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende muñecas,guantes,gorros entre otras artesanias,la socia vende en el mercado,ella tiene un puesto,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar muñecas,guantes,gorros y telares.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is in the business of selling crafts. She sells dolls, gloves, hats, and other handmade items. She sells in the market where she has a stand. She works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM. She has had her business for 4 years and is doing well. Her dream is to expand the business of selling handicrafts. She is asking for a loan to buy dolls, gloves, hats and looms. 

The borrower is happy for the granting of loans and she promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy dolls, gloves, hats, and looms.

loans.name: Sacsayhuaman Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende gorros, pantalones, chompas y guantes, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, en sus tiempos libres la socia le gusta preparar tortas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como gorros, telares, pantalones y guantes.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de pinturas y negocio de venta de vinos.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Sacsayhuaman" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
Sra. Antonia is 48, married, and has four children. She has a business selling handcrafts. She sells wool caps, pants, sweaters, and gloves. Antonia has had this business for five years and it is going very well for her. In her free time, she likes to make cakes. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Her dream is to expand her crafts business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of handcraft items such as wool caps, looms, pants, and gloves.
The other members have other businesses: a restaurant, a grocery store, a painting sales business, and wine sales.
Antonio thanks those who will form part of this dream through this loan. She promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy handcraft items such as wool caps, looms, pants, and gloves.

loans.name: Prosperemos- Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROSPEREMOS-CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Flor Carina ella es soltera y tiene 30 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas, polos, blusas y pantalones. 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de útiles escolares y negocio de venta de vinos.
Los socios que estan pegados en la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidierpon permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Prosperemos-Cusco communal bank, located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
Sra. Flor Carina is 30, single, and has one child. She has a clothing sales business and sells pants, blouses, sweaters, and polos. She has had this business for four years and it is going very well for her. She is getting her children ahead through this business. Her dream is to have a store in which to sell her clothing.        
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sweaters, polos, blouses, and pants. The other members have the following businesses: a restaurant, a grocery store, a school supplies store, and wine sales. 
The members inserted into the group photo had their photos taken after the group photo was taken. They asked permission to do so for reasons to do with their work.
Flor Carina thanks those who will become part of this dream through this loan and promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, polos, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia sigue con su negocio el tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como gaseosas.
texts.en:
This member continues with her grocery business.  She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, snacks, and other things.  She’s been doing this for many years and things are going well, thanks to the dedication she puts into her business each day.  She is a responsible, dedicated woman and gets her family ahead in this way.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise, such as soft drinks

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Solidaridad 2011 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD 2011”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Miluska ella es soltera y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende lapiceros,cuadernos,borradores y papeles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 2 años en este negocio y le va muy bien antes al socia trabajaba como secretaria pero el dinero que ganaba no le alcanzaba para el diario de su casa, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores y papeles.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de peluches, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de ferretería.
El socio que esta tapado su cara con un circulo, se retiro del banco comunal Solidaridad 2011 por motivos de trabajo.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “Solidaridad 2011” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Miluska is single, 35 years old, and has two children.  She has a bookstore, sells pencils, notebooks, erasures, and paper, and works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She’s had this business for two years and things are going well for her.  She used to work as a secretary, but the she did not earn enough money for the household.  Her dream is to expand her business and will use the money from this loan to buy notebooks, pencils, erasures and paper.

The other members sell stuffed animals, groceries, hardware, and raise animals.

The member with his face covered left the Solidaridad 2011 communal bank due for reasons of work. 

[Miluska] is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way and promises to make her payments within the established timeline.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”LOS ANGELES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua dedicandose a la cosmetólogia,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicandose a esta profesion,la socia trabaja en un local por el cento de la ciudad,la socia realiza diferentes tipos de cortes,peinados entre otros,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de tintes,tijeras entre otros.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “Los Angeles” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She continues to be a cosmetologist and has been doing this for some time.  She works in a central city location and does different types of cuts, styles, and other things.  This is how she gets her family ahead.  She is asking for this loan to buy tints, scissors, and other things.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sr De Coylloritty De Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITTY DE CACHIMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina ella es soltera y tiene 28 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa para niños, la socia vende pantalones,chompas,polos y casacas, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6.00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir con sus amigas, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas, polos, casacas y pantalones.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de cuyes.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “SR DE COYLLORITTY DE CACHIMAYO” communal bank, located in the district of Anta, within the Cusco province, and department.

Marina is single, 28 years old, and sells children’s clothing, such as pants, sweaters, polo shirts, and jackets.  She sells on her own in different places and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She’s been doing this for eight years and things are going well.  In her free time she likes to go out with her friends.  Her dream is to have a place from where she can sell her clothing.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sweaters, polo shirts, jackets, and pants.

The other members sell vegetables, groceries, and raise animals such as Guinea pigs.

She is grateful to those who form a part of this dream through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; La socia continua con su negocio de venta de papa,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para al compra de papa para a su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “Los Angeles” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Gregoria continues with her potato selling business and has been doing this for several years.  Things have been going well for her, thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She sells in the Cusco markets and is a very responsible and dedicated woman who gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy potatoes for her business.

She is happy about this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Lida; la socia sigue con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia viaja cada cierto tiempo a diferentes poblados para distribuir su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para al compra de zanahorias,tomates entre otros para su negocio.
texts.en:
Lida continues with her business, buying and selling vegetables.  She has been doing this for several years and things have gone well, thanks to the hard work she puts in each day.  She travels to different population centers to distribute her merchandise to customers who have made requests.  In this way she gets her family ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy carrots, tomatoes, and other things for her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetales.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Augusta; la socia cuenta con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos para su negocio como arroz,azucar,gasesoas,leche,aceites entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gasosas y azucar para su negocio.
texts.en:
Augusta has a grocery business and has been doing this for several years.  Things have gone well, thanks to the dedication she puts into her business each day.  She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, soft drinks, milk, cooking oil, and other things and is a responsible and hardworking person who gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy soft drinks and sugar for her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos para su negocio como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gaseosas para su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member continues to work in her grocery store.  She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, snacks, and other things.  She’s been doing this for many years and things are going well, thanks to the effort she puts in each day.  She is responsible and hardworking and gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy soft drinks for her business.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Soknim's Group

texts.en: Soknim, 40, is a villager from Kampong Cham Province and a married mother of two children who are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband grow rice. To supplement the family’s income, she also buys cassava for resale. The current business has helped her to earn up to 26,400 KHR per day. Including this cycle, she is a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With her past loan, she wisely supported her rice farming business and improved her household progressively. Now, she joins a group of three to seek a new loan; she is the group's leader. Soknim will use her portion to pay the harvesting fees for her cassava field. She highly hopes that she can double her yield and make more income. With this income, she can maintain her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to have her cassava field harvested.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Seangkun's Group

texts.en: A 56-year-old farmer from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Seangkun is married and has eight children. She grows rice and vegetables in order to help support her family. She has done so for 30 years and now earns about 22,700 KHR per day. In a group of three women who are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Seangkun is the group leader. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, the same amount as one of her fellow group members, while the third member is seeking 500,000 KHR. Seangkun is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes to increase her income so she can gradually improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy is 33 years old and the only breadwinner in a family consisting of five children, some of whom are in school and some of whom are too young for schooling. To sustain his family, he does rice farming on three hectares of farmland as his main income and plants vegetables as a secondary source of income. His original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was five loan cycles ago. He has repaid the past loan completely; this has helped him to better support his rice farm and returned him a good income to maintain his living. Now, he is applying for a new loan. He is going to use his loan to increase his savings to buy a mini-tractor for his rice farming business. He hopes this purchase will help him to grow his rice in a timely and productive manner.

loans.use: to buy a mini-tractor to support his rice farming.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is a 51-year-old mother of six, with two children in school.  She resides in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province.  Her family has struggled to survive through the dry season of paddy rice growing.  The 30 years’ experience in this business has helped her to earn up to 26,000 KHR per day.  Ra has been with VisionFund for three cycle loans including this cycle.  She has successfully paid back the loans, which have relieved her family burden and helped to keep up good progress of her business.

Now she is in need of working capital and is requesting a new loan with VisionFund.  For this new loan cycle, she is going to use some portion to support her rice farm, including the purchase of 8 sacks of fertilizer and insecticide.  In addition, she will use a portion of it to buy pigs to raise as extra income.  She hopes to increase income from both of her businesses so as she can keep her children in school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pigs.

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en:
Ith is a 60-year-old mother of eight children, one still in school.  She lives under a thatched roof house located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province.  She has managed three hectares of farmland where her rice crop is growing in order to support her entire household.  The current business earns about 22,200 KHR per day.  The main challenge for her business is the lower crop productivity.  

To tackle this issue, she forms a group of four to apply for a new loan.  She and one of her co-borrowers are fifth-time clients while another one is a fourth-time borrower, and a remaining one is a second-time borrower with VisionFund.  The past loan, which she has paid back with success, has supported her business.  Now, the total amount of her group loan is 4,700,000 KHR.  Ith will spend her portion, 1,400,000 KHR, to buy two pigs for raising and fertilizer for her rice farm.  She hopes that she can get more yield and income so that she can cover her children’s education, improve her living conditions, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, along with her family, lives in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She is 41 years old and has seven children. Currently, only three children still count on her as they are still in school. To deal with daily basic needs, Mao grows rice on three hectares of farmland as her main source of income. She also is able to earn extra income from sweets, cigarettes, and rice wine selling. She has been with her business for 22 years and is able to earn up to 29,800 KHR per day. 

This is the second cycle for Mao and she is the group leader. She has used her past loan wisely to inject good retained earnings into her business. Now, she is forming a group of six to seek a new loan. She and four of her co-members are second-cycle clients, whereas the remaining member is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). 

Mao will use her portion to buy two pigs for raising, grocery items for resale as extra income and a water pump to support her rice farm. She hopes to make more income so that she can expand her business for her children's sake, especially through raising ducks, chickens and pigs and setting up a small stall for more income.

loans.use: To buy pigs, grocery items for resale and a water pump.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Srey is a 39-year-old mother who has three children to cater for as they are still in school. She has one hectare each for growing paddy rice and cassava in order to overcome the daily household expenses. For the 19 years that she has engaged in this business, she is able to earn up to 5,8000 KHR per day and save about 8,300 KHR per day after offsetting all the expenses. 

This is not the original loan for Srey because she has been with VisionFund, a partner of Kiva, for the past five loan cycles. She has used her past loan wisely to upgrade her living conditions to proper standards and has repaid back the entire loan amount with success too. Now, she is in need of working capital for supporting her cash crop. Therefore, she forms a group of three--one is a sixth-time borrower and another one is a third-time borrower. All of them are applying for the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Srey is going to spend her loan portion to pay for the labor fees to collect her cassava's yield. 

She hopes to gather high cassava output during the pitch price so that she can make more income to maintain her living condition.

loans.use: to pay for the labor fee to collect her cassava's yield.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of three schoolchildren and living in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sreypov is married and a diligent farmer. She grows rice on two hectares of farmland and plants cassava on one hectare. She is able to earn up to 29,000 KHR per day from this current business, which she has been involved with for six years. Now, her lifestyle has improved gradually due to the past five consecutive loans that she has applied for with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

Whenever she applies for a new loan, each past loan has already been repaid with success. This is the sixth loan cycle for Sreypov and the fifth cycle for her co-borrower of the same group of two members. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her fellow group member is only requesting 500,000 KHR. As the leader, Sreypov is going to use her portion to pay for the labor fee for plowing her farmland and to buy fertilizer to boost her crop production. 

She hopes that she can increase her income so she can set aside some money to build a new house for her family and to improve her living.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap is aged 32 and is a local citizen from Dambae District of Kampong Cham Province. She is the mother of four children. Currently, she needs to support three of her children as they are still in school. She and her husband deal with their daily necessary expenses from their earnings from growing two hectares of cassava and a half hectare of paddy rice. She has been in this business for 14 years, earning about 26,300 KHR per day. Sopheap, a third-time borrower, has been joined by a first-time borrower, forming a group of two, to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loan has empowered her to sustain her living conditions. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to pay plowing fees and to purchase fertilizer. She hopes to triple her output and sell it at a good price, thereby helping her to make a good living.

loans.use: to use her loan portion to pay plowing fees and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Pheoun

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of Kror Kor district in Cambodia's Pursat province, Pheoun is 58 years of age and married. She is also a mother of four children. Pheoun supports her family through farming rice on a four-hectare plot of land, earning around 5.9 USD per day. She is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loan has helped her to buy household supplies. Now, Pheoun is requesting a USD 1,100 loan to expand her rice-growing business by purchasing more plots of land. After receiving and wisely using the requested loan, Pheoun believes that she can generate more profit for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more plots of land.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An, 49 years old, lives in Pursat province's Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with seven children, one of whom (a son) is under her responsibility and currently in school. To make a living, An works as a rice farmer while her husband makes palm juice to earn more income for the family. Together, this hardworking couple can earn around 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is An's first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She is seeking a KHR 1,000,000 loan to build a comfortable house for her children. After receiving and using the loan as she plans, An will be very satisfied to see her children have an appropriate house to live in.

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha is 42 years of age and married. She and her family live in a rural village in the Kror Kor district of Cambodia's Pursat province. Sopha is blessed with two daughters and three sons, all of whom are school-aged children and still under her responsibility. 

To support the family, Sopha and her husband work as rice farmers. To add more income to the family, Sopha also raises pigs while her husband works as a paid worker. Each day, this industrious couple earns approximately 13,000 KHR. 

This is Sopha's very first time requesting a loan via VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She is seeking a KHR 2,000,000 loan to support the family's rice-growing business by purchasing a head of buffalo. Via the help of this loan, Sopha believes that she can smoothly operate the rice-growing business as well as generate more income for the family. She is willing to dedicate all the efforts that she has put into her work to advance her school-aged children's education as far as possible.

loans.use: To purchase a head of buffalo.

loans.name: Kimsreang's Group

texts.en:
A 37-year-old villager named Kimsreang resides in the Kror Kor district in Pursat province, Cambodia. He makes his living through farming rice, the business in which he has been involved for more than ten years, earning around 14,000 KHR daily. He has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for three loan cycles already, with which he succeeded in securing his food needs. 

Now, he is leading a loan group of two members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group representative, Kimsreang will utilize his loan portion to buy fertilizer to help keep his rice field in good shape. He expects a boost in his income via the help of this loan portion.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Saet's Group

texts.en:
57-year-old Saet is a resident in a rural area of Kror Kor district in Cambodia's Pursat province. She is a widow and a mother of seven children, one of whom (a son) is under her responsibility and currently a student in grade eight. To continually support the family, Saet has been working as a rice farmer for almost 30 years. She earns around 7,500 KHR per day. 

Saet is leading a loan group of three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR in total. She will utilize her loan portion to pay the cost of labor. She hopes to see improvement in the living standards of her family as well as to be able to support her school-aged child's education.

loans.use: To pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: Phan is a 58-year-old mother of five children who is originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province.  Her daily income comes from raising pigs and growing rice on 1.5 hectares of land.  Her husband helps on the farm and also works for another.  She is able to earn up to 16,200 KHR per day from the current business, which she has been with for 29 years.  Phan’s original loan has supported her business gradually and she has already repaid it.  Now, she forms a group of two to seek a new loan.  As the group leader, Phan is going to spend her portion on the harvesting fee and pig feed.  She hopes to receive high yield and to make more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay the harvesting fee and to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, 47, lives in the Kror Kor district of Cambodia's Pursat province. She is married and has four children, with three daughters who are dependent on her and are currently in school. Ly earns her living through farming rice, earning around 17,000 KHR daily. She has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles already, through which she accomplished buying household supplies.

Now Ly is in need of money to purchase a horse, so she is leading a group member, who has just been with VisionFund for the first time, to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. The group leader, Ly, will also spend her loan portion on the rental fees of her rice field. Ly expects a boost in her income and is willing to use the anticipated income to pursue the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok, 57 years old, is a villager living in the Ek Phnom district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is a school-aged child (a son). 

To make a living, Sok and her husband farm rice and plant beans. Sok’s husband also works as a fisherman to add more income to the family. Together, they are able to earn around 19,000 KHR daily and, after offsetting the daily cost of living, save approximately 7,000 KHR for future needs. This will be Sok’s fourth time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loans have enabled her to improve the family’s lifestyle. 

She is now leading a female group member, who is a second-time borrower. They are taking out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR respectively. The group leader, Sok, will spend some portion of her loan on buying fertilizer and paying wages to farm laborers. The other portion of the loan will be spent on buying cast nets and fish traps to support her husband’s fish-catching business. Via the help of this requested loan portion, Sok will be able to generate more income for the family and better support her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Ven's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district in Cambodia, Ven is a 42-year-old married woman. She has six children, two (a daughter and a son) of whom are under her responsibility and currently in school. Ven and her husband earn their living through farming rice, earning approximately 30,000 KHR daily and saving about 14,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. Ven has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five loan cycles already. With those loans, she has succeeded in fixing her house and supporting her rice-growing business. Now she is leading a group member who has just been with VisionFund for one loan cycle to take out a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. With the requested loan portion, Ven plans on buying fertilizer and paying for labor. She will be able to increase her income and better support the education of her beloved school-aged children after receiving and wisely using her loan portion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Han is a villager who resides in a rural village of the Dambae district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is 40 years of age and married with two dependent kids, both of whom are in school. Han earns a living through planting cassava, which enables her to earn around 28,000 KHR per day and save about 9,000 KHR for future needs after canceling out the expenses. 

Han has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for a loan cycle already, with which she accomplished relieving the family’s burden. Now she is leading a loan group of two female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 250,000 KHR each. Han will utilize her loan portion to support her cassava-planting business by purchasing fertilizer and pesticide. This hardworking mother would love to dedicate all the efforts that she has put into her work to moving her family ahead and further advancing her beloved school-age children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Jis

texts.en:
A villager named Jis resides in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district in Cambodia. She is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two school-aged children, both of whom are her responsibility. Jis supports her family through planting cassava and selling grocery items. 

This will be her sixth time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loans have helped her to gradually support her family and to satisfy her customers by enabling her to buy more grocery items to sell. Now Jis is seeking a 4,000,000 KHR loan to support her cassava-planting business by purchasing fertilizer and pesticide. She will also use her loan portion to buy rice to sell in hopes of generating more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Neoun's Group

texts.en:
36-year-old Neoun is a citizen living in the Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is married and a mother of two kids, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Neoun makes her living through planting cassava, which enables her to earn approximately 30,000 KHR per day. Neoun has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in sending her beloved kids to school. 

Now she is leading a female group member, who has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles, to seek a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group representative, Neoun will spend her requested loan portion on renting more plots of land to plant cassava. Her biggest hope is to advance her children’s education as far as possible.

loans.use: To rent more plots of land.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Torb's Group

texts.en:
Torb, aged 40 years, is a villager in a rural village of Moung Russey district in Cambodia's Battambang province. She is married and has five children.

Torb has been working so tirelessly for ten years as a rice farmer to continually support the family. Each day, she is able to earn approximately 28,000 KHR. Torb, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), is leading a loan group of three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. The group leader Torb will utilize her loan portion to pay the cost of labor. Torb has a dream of being able to expand her rice-growing business by buying more plots of farm.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Saven's Group

texts.en:
Saven is 60 years of age and married. She and her family live in a rural area of Thmor Koul district in Battambang province, Cambodia. Saven has seven children, four of whom are employed as paid workers. 

Saven makes her living through farming rice. Saven, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), is leading a group member who also is a first-time borrower to apply for a loan in the amount of 200,000 KHR each. As a group representative, Saven will spend her loan portion on buying fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. She expects a boost in her income as well as an improvement in the family's living standard via the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Unión Y Prosperidad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Unión y Prosperidad es un banco comunal está formado por amigos y familiares quienes tienen una buena relación y en cada reunión estrechan aun mas sus lasos de amistad, son personas trabajadoras, amables, gentiles y de un gran corazón quienes aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, laboran en diferentes actividades pero en especial del campo como es la crianza de animales y la agricultura lo que le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica. Viven por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca lugar que goza de una gran belleza natural y se puede disfrutar de la armonía de la naturaleza gracias a sus campos de verde vegetación.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Silvia María, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y viven  independientes y sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora como aserrador (se dedica a la tala de árboles para la elaboración de tablas), la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Silvia María se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y al trabajo del campo, cría borregos, gallinas y ganando del cual vende la leche, sus otros animales los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica,también se dedica a  la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es tener más animales para la cría.

La foto pequeña es de dos socios que pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del  grupo.
texts.en:
'Unión y Prosperidad' is a communal bank made up of friends and family members who have good relationships and bond more and more with every meeting. They are hard-working, kind, and friendly people with big hearts. They still maintain their culture and traditions. They work in various areas but the majority work in the fields in agriculture or raising animals. This allows them to improve their economic stability. They live in the Zhidmad parish in Cuenca, an area with great natural beauty. There one can enjoy harmony with nature thanks to the fields that are green with vegetation.
One of the group members is Señora Silvia María. She is 53, married, and has five children. Three of her children are married and live independently. Her two single children work and help her economically. Her husband works as a sawyer (he cuts trees for making boards). They own their own home.
Silvia María cares for their home and works in agriculture. She raises sheep, hens, and cattle. She sells her cows' milk. She sells her other animals when she has need. She also farms for her household's consumption, and if they have anything left over she sells it.
She will invest this new loan in the purchase of livestock.
Her goal is to have more animals to raise.
The small inserted photo is of two members who were not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 45 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y estudian en la universidad. Su esposo es técnico dental.

Doña Martha es una ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en materiales para su trabajo y ella en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio el cual le gusta porque se siente útil y con sus ganancias puede ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios.
  
Este crédito es para comprar materiales odontológicos y ropa para aprovechar le época que más vende y que mejores ganancias le deja. Lleva más de 16 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre les ha brindado la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas [Women United] Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa, the canton known as the Sultana of Coffee due to its extensive cultivation of coffee with an incomparable flavor. It is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

It is here that Martha lives. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two children from that relationship who are already grown and studying at the university. Her husband is a dental technician.

Martha is a housewife who took the loan so that her husband could use it for materials for his work and so that she could use it for her business. She makes a living by selling clothing from a catalogue and her means of selling is door-to-door. She has had her business for more than 10 years, and she likes it because she feels useful and because with her earnings she is able to help her children with the expenses for their studies.
  
This loan is to buy dental materials and clothing to take advantage of the time in which they sell the most and make the best profit. She has been with the Communal Bank for more than 16 years and likes it because of the help they have always gotten from the Fundación Espoir.
 
Her dream is that her children will have good professional careers.

loans.use: to buy clothes and dentistry materials.

loans.name: Ena Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Ena, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero cuatro  de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Ena para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vende todo tipo de víveres además de  legumbres, verduras y frutas, ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería, ella invierte los créditos en su tienda pero esta vez como todos los años en esta fecha la mitad del dinero del crédito es para comprar semillas, fertilizantes e insecticidas para que su marido las utilice en los cultivos que siembra en el ciclo invernal.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que el anterior le dejo buenas ganancias con las cuales pudo solventas muchos gastos de su hogar. Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar víveres para su tienda, semillas, fertilizantes e insecticidas para el negocio de su esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace más de 16  años y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día
texts.en:
The communal bank of Mujeres Unidas meet twice a month in the canton of Jipijapa, a canton known as the Sultana of Coffee because of the extensive coffee plantations which produce an incomparable flavor, for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Ena lives here. She is 61 years old, married and has six adult children with four of them still living with her. Her husband is a farmer.

In order to help meet the household expenses Ena has a business. She has a little store in her home where she sells all types of provisions including legumes, vegetables, fruit, various bazaar items and stationery. She invests the loans in her store but this time every year half of the money is to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticides for her husband to use on the crops that he grows in the winter cycle.

She is repeating her loan as the previous one left her with good earnings with which she could pay many of the household expenses. She will use this loan to buy provisions for her store, seed, fertilizers and insecticides for her husband’s business. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning more than 16 years ago and she likes it because she has made many friends in the group.

Her goals are to continue getting ahead in her business and for her store to grow every day.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her own grocery store and seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her husband's business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 35 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 16 y de 9 años, dos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela, la mayor ya está casada pero aun vive en su casa.

Doña Elizabeth para poder salir adelante y para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada se dedica a la venta de comida para lo cual puso hace más de seis años un  pequeño comedor en su casa, 	allí todos los días por la tardes  prepara deliciosos platos, su especialidad son las deliciosa fritada acompañada de plátano asado o patacones lo cual es muy apetecido por sus clientes, trabaja sola y a veces con la ayuda de sus hijos cuando están desocupados, es así como ella sale sola adelante con sus hijos.

Ella esta repitiendo el crédito ya que el anterior le dejo buenas ganancias las cuales fueron de mucha ayuda para su familia. Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" ["Women United"] meets twice a month in Jipijapa canton, a canton known as the "Coffee Sultaness" for its extensive plantings of coffee, which has an incomparable flavor. Jipijapa is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

35-year-old Elizabeth lives here. She is separated and has three children, ages 19, 16, and 9. The two older children are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Elizabeth’s older daughter is now married but still lives at home.

To make a living and so that her children never lack anything, Elizabeth works selling food. More than seven years ago, she set up a small eatery in her house. There she prepares delicious dishes every afternoon. Her specialty is fritada with roasted plantains or patacones, which is very appetizing to her customers. She works alone and sometimes with the help of her children, when they aren't busy. This is how she supports her children by herself.

Elizabeth is now seeking another loan as the earlier one resulted in a larger income, greatly benefitting the family. She will use the loan money to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies for the dishes she makes. She has been in the communal bank for ten years and she likes it for the financial help it provides.

Her goals are to continue with her business and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other groceries.

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba desde hace 7 años, en el cual ha estrechado sus lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, vive  en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 52 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos, 6 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, una de sus hijas trabaja para sus gastos y tres están estudiando dos en el colegio y uno en la escuela de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios de manera independiente, la casa en la que viven es propia. 

La Señora María para ayudar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la venta de quesos, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace 20 años, sale a vender 4 días de la semana sin horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de ganado y cerdos y también a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es solo pare el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de quesos para continuar con su negocio. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the Cochapamba communal bank for seven years, through which she has strengthened her friendships with all her fellow members from the communal bank. María lives in the parish of Valle in Cuenca, a place where the people make their living in agriculture and rearing animals, they are a friendly and courteous people who still maintain their culture and traditions.

María is 52 years old, she is married and as a result of her marriage she has 10 children, 6 of whom are married and live independently. One of her daughters works for her upkeep and three are studying, two at secondary school and one at the local school. Her husband works as a driver and offers his services on a freelance basis. The home in which they live is their own.

To help with her family's finances, María sells cheese, an activity which she has been performing for 20 years. Maria goes out to sell 4 days a week without a fixed timetable. At home, María spends her time rearing cattle and pigs, as well as in agriculture, the harvest of which is for her family's consumption only.

María will invest this new loan in the purchase of cheese to continue with her business. María's dream is that her children become upstanding professionals.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del banco comunal Cochapamba hace algún tiempo en donde ha llegado a afianzar su amistad con todas sus compañeras, vive en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados, uno de ellos vive independiente y el otro vive en su casa, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica al a cría de pollos, borregos y ganado, esta actividad la aprendió desde muy joven y ahora le permite aportar a la economía de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y borregos. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo y solidaridad de todas las integrantes.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Cochapamba communal bank and it’s been sometime since she made friends with all of her fellow members.  She lives in the Valle en Cuenca parish where the people farm and raise livestock.  They are gentle, friendly people who maintain their culture and traditions.

María is 50 years old, married, and has three children, two of who are married and on their own.  The other son lives at home.  Her single son works and helps her financially.  Her husband works as a mason in construction.  She owns her home.

María raises chickens, sheep, and other livestock and has been doing this since she was very young.  Now it allows her to support her household.

She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens and sheep.  She likes the communal bank because of the camaraderie and unity among all of its members.

loans.use: to buy chickens and sheep.

loans.name: Las Cuencanitas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Cuencanitas está conformado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca pero les une una meta en común la cual es superarse en sus negocios y sacar adelante a toda su familia, todos los miembros del grupo son personas positivas, alegres y luchadoras. Cuenca es una ciudad que tiene una gran belleza tanto natural como arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jessica, es una mujer muy joven que tiene 19 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo que tiene 8 meses de edad, su esposo es propietario de un taller de estucos (fabrica cielos rasos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Jessica es se dedica al comercio, vende juguetes y labora todos los días sin un horario fijo, esta actividad la desempeña hace 3 años, cuando ella no está vendiendo le ayuda a su esposo en el taller.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de juguetes.

Como le gusta el arte de la gastronomía su meta es de llegar a tener su propio restaurante.

El señor que está en extremo izquierdo de la foto no pertenece al grupo, es el esposo de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The Las Cuencanitas communal bank is made up of eight women and one man who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, but their goals of succeeding in their businesses and getting their families ahead unite them.  All of the group’s members are positive, happy and hardworking people.  Cuenca is a city of great natural an architectural beauty.  It was named as a World Heritage Site in 1999.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Jessica is one of the members and is very young, 19.  She lives in a common law marriage and has an 8 month old son.  Her husband owns a stucco factory (makes ceilings).  They live in a rented home.

Jessica sells toys and works every day without a fixed schedule.  She’s been doing this for three years and helps her husband in his shop when she’s not selling.
  
She will use the money from this loan to buy toys.

She wants to open a restaurant, since she enjoys cooking.

The man on the far left of the image is not part of the group, but is the husband of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: San Miguel  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
San Miguel es un banco comunal que se encuentra conformado por 6 socias quienes son amigas y conocidas, una parte del grupo son familia que en cada reunión estrechan sus lasos de amistad y fraternidad. Viven por la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre del banco comunal que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que tiene un gran movimiento comercial, muchos se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres les han inculcado.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosa, forma parte de la banca comunal hace 12 años, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, uno de sus hijos es casado y vive independiente, dos de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su ultima hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que trabaja como maestro albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a lavar ropa 3 días a la semana  sin un horario fijo ya que se regresa a casa cuando termina, en casa se dedica a su hogar y a la cría de cerdos, pollos, ovejas y conejos a los que los vende en su comunidad.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es terminar su casa.

En la foto está una ex socia la cual está con una gorra roja.
texts.en:
San Miguel is a communal bank that is composed of six women who are friends and acquaintances. One part of the group is a family that reaches out in friendship and sisterhood at each of the meetings. They live in the community that bears the same name as the communal bank, which is in the parish of Valle in Cuenca. The parish has a lot of commercial activity. Many people work in agriculture and grain farming. The people are friendly and courteous, and they keep up the culture and traditions that their parents passed on to them.

One of the members of this group is Rosa. She has been part of the communal bank for 12 years. She is 41 years old and married. In her marriage, she has conceived four children, one of whom is married and lives independently. Two of her children work and help out financially. Her youngest daughter is studying at a college in the city. Her husband works in construction and teaches bricklaying. The house that the family lives in is their own.
