Sus habitantes son personas muy trabajadoras que laboran día a día en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir adelante, su carisma y alegría les caracterizan ya que a pesar de sus dificultades nunca dejan su buen humor, aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mónica Patricia, está realizando su sexto crédito en conjunto con sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, en este grupo ha encontrado una amistad incondicional de todas las socias y un buen compañerismo. Vive por el sector  El Cruce que pertenece a la parroquia de Sinincay.

La Señora Mónica Patricia tiene 36 años de edad, está separada de marido pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos, su primera hija tiene 14 años de edad y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su segundo hijo tiene un año de edad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos de la casa.

Doña Mónica Patricia trabaja de lunes a viernes en una oficina como asistente de contadores, labora en esta actividad hace un año pero solo medio día, el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su hogar y a la crianza y venta de animales como: pollos, cuyes y conejos. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes, conejos y alimento para animales.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Cruce Hacia el Futuro is made up of 9 women who are friends and neighbors living in the outskirts of the parish Sinincay in Cuenca. This parish has a beautiful church, delightful landscapes and many places to enjoy nature. Its people are hardworking and work in various financial activities which permit them to pay household expenses and get ahead. Charisma and joy characterize them and despite their difficulties their good humor never leaves them, and they still maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Mónica Patricia who is making her sixth loan together with her friends and companions from the communal bank El Cruce Hacia el Futuro. This group has found unconditional friendship among its members and good camaraderie. She lives in the El Cruce area that belongs to the parish of Sinincay.

Mónica Patricia is 36 years old. She is separated from her husband and has two children from her marriage. Her oldest daughter is 14 years old and goes to school in the city, and her younger son is one year old. She does not have her own home but lives in her mother’s home with whom she shares the household expenses.

Mónica Patricia works from Monday through Friday in an office as an assistant bookkeeper. She has been working in the job for a year, working half a day. The rest of her time she works at home breeding and selling animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and rabbits.

She will use her new loan to invest in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, rabbits and animal feed for the animals.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, rabbits, and animal feed.

loans.name: Sopheoun's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old married woman named Sopheoun resides in a rural village of Moung Russey District in Battambang, Cambodia. She is blessed with a son who is too young to attend school. To continually support the family, Sopheoun and her husband have been farming rice on a two hectare plot of land and planting sesame on a hectare plot of land for five years. The current business can earn this hardworking couple around 22,000 riels (KHR) daily. 

This will be Sopheoun’s second time requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The previous loan has enabled Sopheoun to meet the family’s needs and better support the family. Now she would like to expand her current business by buying more plots of land. Thus, Sopheoun is leading a group of two to apply for a loan in the amount of 2,200,000 KHR in total. After receiving and using the loan portion as she plans, Sopheoun believes that she will be able to increase her productivity generating more income for the family. In the future, she is willing to send her only son to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more plots of land

loans.name: Las Del Río  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las del Rio está formado por 6 mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias y mejorar su estabilidad económica, vive por la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca,  lugar se encuentra rodeado por exuberante naturaleza y hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica la artesanía ya que elaboran sogas, también se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, conforma el banco comunal Las del Rio hace dos años y medio, tiempo en el que ha logrado afianzar sus lasos de amistad con todas las socias. 
 
La Señora Ana tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años, su primera hija pasa en casa ayudando con los quehaceres del hogar, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es su propia.
 
Ella la crianza de animales como: borregos, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, tiene un invernadero en donde cultiva tomates para la venta, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su invernadero. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser  buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Las del Rio communal bank is made up of 6 enterprising women who fight day to day to get their families ahead and improve their financial stability. They live in the Jadan parish of Cuenca, a place surrounded by natural beauty and beautiful landscapes. Its people work in artisanal crafts, making rope. They also work in farming and raise animals. 

One of the members of this group is Ana. She has been a member of the Las del Rio communal bank for two years and a half. During that time, se has been able to establish friendships with all of the members. 

Ana is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 11. Her oldest daughter stays at home and helps with the household work, and her younger son goes to school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They own the house they live in.
 
She raises animals such as: sheep, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs, She also has a greenhouse where she grows tomatoes to sell. She also farms and what she harvests is for household consumption. 

She will invest the money from the loan in buying construction materials to make some improvements on her greenhouse.

Her dream is for her children to have professional careers

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou is 48 years old, married and a mother of four children, two of whom (a son and a daughter) still live at home and attend school. She lives in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, where she and her husband earn a decent life for the family by farming rice and planting corn. They have been in this line of work for about 10 years and earn about 45,000 KHR daily. Chanthou is requesting her third loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully used her previous two loans to improve her family's life. She is requesting a new loan to pay for the cost of hiring people to help out on her farm. She leads a three-person loan group in which each member is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR. She believes that this loan will give her a better crop and help her advance the education of her school-aged children.

loans.use: to hire workers to help on a farm.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is 42 years old and is married with 6 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Lona needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush-knives, a weedkiller spray, and more tiapula, as well as to improve her family assets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Lona will use the profits from her sales to graduate her children from college.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, bush-knives, etc.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch, 59 years old, lives in Cambodia in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is married and the mother of three children. Touch and her husband have been farming rice and planting sesame tirelessly for the last ten years to support their family. Each day, they are able to earn approximately 49,000 KHR through their hard work. This will be Touch’s third request for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She was very satisfied with her prior two loans because they helped her meet her family’s needs. Now, Touch is leading a group of three people who seek a loan for 4,000,000 KHR. Touch will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the cost of hiring people to help her with her crop. She believes  that this loan will give her a good-quality harvest which will allow her to earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for the cost of hiring helpers.

loans.name: María Ines

texts.es:
La señora María es una socia fundadora que del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive por un sector muy conocido de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, lugar se encuentra rodeado por exuberante naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la artesanía ya que elaboran sogas, también se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales. 

Doña María tiene 61 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
 
La Señora María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como vive en el campo labora en la agricultura, sus cosechas las vende y también son para consumo de su hogar. Cría y vende  cuyes, cerdos, borregos y ganado. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió de sus padres la elaboración de sogas y esto le permite tener un ingreso extra en su hogar. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de piola para elaborar las sogas, abono para sus sembríos, cuyes y cerdos. 

Su meta es sacar adelante a toda su familia.
texts.en:
María is a founding member of the Vegaspamba communal bank.  She lives in a well-known part of the Jadan parish.  The area is surrounded by lush vegetation.  Its people devote themselves to crafts; they make ropes.  They also devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.

María, age 61, is married, and she and her husband have nine children.  All of her children are grown, married, and live independently.  Her husband is a farmer, and she lives in her own house.

María devotes herself to the household chores.  As she lives in the countryside that works in farming, she sells her harvests.  Her harvests are also for her household’s consumption.  She raises and sells guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, and livestock.  When she was a very young girl she learned how to make ropes from her parents.  This allows her to have an extra income at home.

She will use the new loan to buy cord to make the ropes, natural fertilizer for her crops, guinea pigs, and pigs.

Her goal is to get her whole family ahead.

loans.use: to buy cord to make ropes, natural fertilizer for her crops, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 49 years old and the married mother of four children, two of whom are dependents. Her dependent children work as mechanics to help support the family. Sinat lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Sangke district. Her family earns an income from rice farming and sometimes working for others for a fee. Sinat has been a farmer for the past ten years. She earns about 46,000 KHR each day and is able to save about 10,000 KHR daily for future needs. Sinat has received five previous loans through VisionFund that she has used to improve the living standards of her family. She has successfully repaid her loans. 

Sinat is the group leader of a four-person loan group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also to buy spare parts for her children's business. In the future, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy ferilizer and spare parts for her children's business

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal, 41, is married with five children and resides in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Two of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice for ten years while her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 21,000 per day and can save about KHR 6,000 each day for their future needs.

Phal has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She fully repaid the loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying soil to refill her house. Phal hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, aged 62 years, is a villager in the Kandal Stoeng district in Cambodia’s Kandal Province. She is a widow and a mother of nine children. 

This single mother works so many jobs to support the family. She farms rice and sells porridge and Khmer noodles, which enables her to earn approximately 29,000 KHR per day and save about 16,000 KHR after canceling out the daily expenses. 

Sokhom has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for twelve loan cycles already. With these loans, she accomplished strengthening her current businesses by increasing her working capital and securing food needs for her family. 

Now Sokhom is leading a group of six female members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. The group representative, Sokhom, will spend her loan portion on paying wages to farm laborers. This industrious single mother hopes to generate more income for the family and better support the family.

loans.use: to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Sim is aged 44 years and widowed with five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school.

She earns a living through planting vegetables such as cabbages, chilies and water convolvulus (water spinach), etc. Having been in this business for five years, she manages to earn about 21,000 KHR per day and can save about 8,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is a group loan for Sim’s group of three who live in the same village. Sim has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sim wants to use her portion to buy a plot of farmland to grow water convolvulus. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to grow water convolvulus

loans.name: Aen's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of the Srey Snom district in Cambodia’s Siem Reap province, Aen is a 60-year-old widow. She is a single mother of seven children, one (a son) of whom is under her responsibility and currently in school. To support the family, Aen works as a rice farmer on a 1.5 hectare (3.7 acre) plot of farmland. She earns about 5,000 KHR each day and saves approximately 2,500 KHR after paying her daily expenses. Aen, a second-time borrower, is leading a group of two. Aen and the group's other member, who is just a first-time borrower, request loans in the amount of 400,000 KHR and 100,000 KHR, respectively, for a total of 500,000 KHR. Her earlier loan enabled Aen to better meet her family’s needs. This time, she will utilize her portion of the loan to pay for the cost of labor. Single mother Aen expects her portion of the loan to help her to harvest her rice on time.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of labor

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is 31 years old, married, and mother to three dependent children. She is a villager living in the Moung Ressey district in Battambang province, Cambodia. Two of Thy’s children are school-aged while the other is too young for school. For the past ten years, Thy and her husband have supported their family by working as rice farmers. They earn approximately 33,000 KHR each day and are able to save about 20,000 KHR after covering their daily expenses. Thy has received six previous loans through VisionFund and has succeeded in improving her family's living standards. 

Thy is requesting a group loan of 3,600,000 KHR. She is the leader of a three-person loan group and will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. She expects to improve the quality of her harvest and boost her income. In the future, she will use the anticipated profit from her loan to advance her beloved children's education and continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Nget is aged 51 years and married. She has five children to take care of and one of them is a dependent and still in school.

To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer on four-hectares of farmland for seven years and she also raises pigs to better feed her children. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Nget has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is asking for a new loan of 2,600,000 KHR to buy feeds for nourishing pigs. Nget hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to increase her family’s income and make a living better.

loans.use: to buy feeds for nourishing pigs

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is 39 years old and married with one daughter who is still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Sokha earns a living selling rice soup and her husband is a solider to earn income to help support their family. Together, she and her husband can earn about 28,000 KHR each day and are able to save about 10,000 KHR daily for the future. Sokha has received three previous loans through VisionFund that have helped her to relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Sokha is the leader of a four-member group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy spices to make rice soup to sell. In the future, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy spices to make rice soup to sell

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Saveoun, 38, is married and blessed with four dependent kids, three of whom are school-aged and one who is too young. She is a citizen in the Moung Russey district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. To support their family, Saveoun and her husband have been farming rice and sesame for the past ten years. They earn about 30,000 KHR each day. 

Saveoun is requesting a 3,800,000 KHR group loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs. She is the leader of a three-woman loan group and this will be her fourth loan. Her past loans have enabled her to better support her family. Saveoun will use her loan to improve the quality of her crop yield and boost her income. In the future, she plans to advance her children's education and send her youngest kid to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is 43 years old and the widowed mother of four children, one of whom is dependent on her. She lives in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. For the past several years, Sor has worked as a rice farmer and her family's income comes from leasing a 1.5 hectare rice paddy.  She earns about 10,000 KHR each day and she manages to save about 4,000 KHR daily for the future. Sor has received three previous loans through VisionFund that she used to improve her rice paddy. She successfully repaid her loans.

Sor is the leader of a four-person loan group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her paddy and also to buy piglets to raise and sell. In the future, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun is a 32-year-old married woman with four dependent kids, two of whom are school-aged and two who are too young to attend school. She and her family live in a rural village of Moung Russey district in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sareoun and her husband are farmers who support their family by planting rice and sesame. Sareoun’s husband also has a fishing business. Together, this industrious couple earns approximately 39,000 KHR each day. 

Sareoun is requesting a 4,000,000 KHR loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund to buy more plots of land. She has received two previous loans that she used to improve her family's standard of living. Sareoun will use her loan to increase her farm's productivity and provide more income for her family. In the future, she hopes to provide for her children's higher education and send her younger children to school.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Sokly is 24 years old and married with one son who is too young for school. She lives in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the last six years, Sokly has been farming rice on four-hectare plot of farmland to provide the primary source of her family’s income. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee. Sokly and her husband can earn about 18,000 KHR daily and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses. Her major business challenge is the lack of water. She has received two previous loans with VisionFund and her fellow group member has received four previous loans. Sokly has successfully repaid her loans.

Sokly is the leader of a group loan request. She will use her portion of the loan to rent a harvesting machine to help with her rice paddy harvest. Sokly hopes to get a high yield from her farmland to improve her living standards and send her son to school.

loans.use: to rent a harvesting machine to help with her rice harvest

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong is a villager residing in a rural village in the Ek Phnom District in Cambodia's Battambang province. She is 32 years of age and married with three dependent kids, some of whom are currently in school. Kong and her husband work as rice farmers to make a living. To add more income to the family, Kong’s husband also works as a paid worker. Together, this industrious couple earns around 21,000 riels (KHR) per day and manages to save approximately 8,000 KHR after canceling out the daily expenses.

Kong, a six time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, is leading a group whose other member is also a sixth time borrower. They are taking out a new loan with VisionFund in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. The group leader, Kong, states that the help she has already received in the form of previous loans has enabled her to accomplish so many things: building a house and improving the family's lifestyle. Now Kong will use her new requested loan portion to support her rice-growing business by purchasing fertilizer and covering the cost of labor. This hardworking Kong would love to dedicate the effort that she has put into her work to moving the family ahead and, most importantly, sending all her children to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
A 61-year-old mother of seven children, Ann resides in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Bakan district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been farming rice on 2-hectares of farmland for 42 years. Low crop yield resulting from floods is the main challenge for her farming business. She can earn about 10,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Ann has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFun, for one loan cycle. She completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group of five to ask for a loan. Ann will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on gasoline for a water pumping machine. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her paddy-field business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth, 29 years old, is a villager in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two dependent sons, one of whom is a student. 

Sareth and her husband have been working so tirelessly as rice farmers for eight years, generating income for the family of approximately 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) daily and saving about 8,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

Sareth is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans have provided a huge positive impact on her as well as her family. She is so satisfied with those loans because she is able to improve her family’s lifestyle and send her children to school, which is a great achievement for her. 

Sareth now is in need of money to pay for the cost of labor and to cover her household expenses. Therefore, she is leading a group of three female members to take out a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 3,400,000 KHR in total. This hardworking mother (Sareth) hopes to generate more income to the family and be able to sufficiently support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of farm labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is 43 years old and married with nine children, five of whom are under her responsibility and either in school or employed. She and her family live in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district in Cambodia.

Pov and her husband work as fishmongers to provide a decent life for the family. Having been in the current business for more than twenty years, this hardworking couple is able to earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR for future needs after deducting the daily cost of living.

This will be Pov’s fifth time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans that she already paid back enabled her to secure food needs for her family, which made her so satisfied. Pov is now leading a group of two female members to seek a loan in the amount of 1,800,000 KHR in total. With her requested loan portion, Pov plans on buying fishing materials such as a fish trap and cast net to support the fish-catching business. Pov hopes to better support the family and advance the education of her children as far as possible.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is 24 years old and a single man. For the past four years, he has been working as a car mechanic. Despite his age, he is successful on his job. He has opened his own workshop and has people doing other different jobs at his workshop. He is quite enough known at the district he lives, with the number of his clients increasing each month. In this way, he gradually built up a customer base. 

Tural would like to expand and do quality work in his shop. He is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for cars. This will allow him to serve even more customers and increase his income. He wishes to get married and have children. These are the reasons why he’s in a real need to amplify his income in order to be able to make the needed savings for his wedding and his future life plans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars for his repair workshop.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of the Kror Kor district in Cambodia’s Pursat province, Sreymao is 22 years of age and married. She is blessed with a son who is still under her responsibility and too young for schooling. To support the family, Sreymao works as a rice farmer while her husband works as a paid worker to complement the family’s income. Together, they are able to earn around 5 USD and save approximately 3 USD after canceling out the daily expenses. 

This will be Sreymao’s second time requesting loan via Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With the previous loan, she was able to cover household expenses. Now, Sreymao is applying for a USD 1,010 loan to purchase a cow to support her rice-growing business. This hard-working mother (Sreymao) would love to be able to send her only son to a good school in the future and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Kimneang's Group

texts.en:
Kimneang is 30 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. For the past 12 years, Kimneang and her husband have been farming rice on five-hectare farmland to provide the main source of her family’s income. This is her first loan with VisionFund.

Kimneang is leading her three-member group to apply for a 1,000,000 KHR for each member. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Kimneang hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
A 48-year-old, Sinoun is a resident of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Camobdia. She is a widow and a mother of three children, one (a daughter) of whom is currently in school and still under her responsibility. 

Sinoun has been working tirelessly as a rice farmer on a two-hectare plot of farm for more than twenty years to continually support the family. Through the current business, she generates income for the family of around 15,000 KHR per day and, after offsetting the daily expenses, saves approximately 9,000 KHR for future needs. 

Sinoun is requesting loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) of an amount of 1,000,000 KHR for the first time. With this requested loan, she will purchase a decent motorbike for use in the family. Via the help of this loan, Sinoun hopes to be able to save the cost of transportation as well as to save time.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is 25 years old, married, and blessed with two dependent daughters. She is a villager in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district in Cambodia. For the past ten years, Channa has been a rice farmer and her family's income comes from a four-hectare plot of land. She generates about 18,000 KHR daily. Channa has received a previous loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund that she used to improve her family's lifestyle. 

Channa is the representative of a group requesting a 1,200,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR loan. She will use her portion of the loan to pay labor costs. Channa is an industrious woman who hopes that her loan will increase her productivity and the quality of her harvest. In the future, she hopes to improve her crop yields and increase her family's income and profit.

loans.use: to pay labor costs

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: El señor Aurelio de 34 años de edad casado con la señora Rosa hace 8 años, ambos con una instrucción de nivel primario, tienen 3 hijos dependientes, la familia vive en un lugar lejano del pueblo de Colomi comunidad Capihuara del municipio de Villa Tunari. El señor Aurelio se dedica a la venta de agregados de construcción arena boleado, arena fina y piedra con Volqueta propio a la vez son agricultores con cultivo de cítricos que mayormente se dedica la esposa en la misma comunidad, de esta forma ellos se mantienen económicamente tanto como para mantener su estudio de sus hijos y otros; Don Aurelio y su esposa necesitan el préstamo para comprar material de construcción calamina para su vivienda de dos plantas que recién está haciendo terminar de construir en lo cual invirtieron todo el ahorro que tenían. Don Aurelio quiere terminar su casa lo más antes posible así para vivir más cómodos ya que la vivienda actual donde viven está en malas condiciones.
texts.en: Aurelio is 34 years old. He has been married to Rosa for 8 years. Both of them have a primary school education. They have 3 dependent children. The family lives in a town far from the town of Colomi, community of Capihuara, of the Villa Tunari municipality. Aurelio sells construction materials such as coarse sand, fine sand and gravel with his own dump truck. They are also farmers and grows citrus fruit. He wife mainly does that, in the same place where they live. In this way, they support themselves financially and pay for their children's education and more. Aurelio and his wife need a loan to buy corrugated iron for his two story house that they are just now finishing construction on. They have invested everything they have in it. Aurelio wants to finish building his house as soon as possible so they can live more comfortably, sine the house they live in now is in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Siem's Group

texts.en:
A 48-year-old, Siem is a villager who lives in a rural area of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She is married and a mother of eight children, four (three daughters and a son) of whom are dependent on her and currently in school. To offer a decent life to the family, Siem and her husband have been working as rice farmers for more than twenty years. To supplement the income, Siem also has a business raising pigs. Each day, Siem and her husband can earn around 11,000 KHR and save approximately 4,000 KHR after taking out the daily cost of living. 

Siem, a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member who also is a second-time borrower to take out a new loan of an amount of 800,000 KHR each. The group leader Siem states that the previous loan has enabled her to guarantee food needs and better support the family. This time, Siem will spend her loan portion on buying fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. After receiving and wisely using the loan, Siem highly believes that her rice field will provide her with a good-quality crop so that she can boost her income and better support her beloved kids’ education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Son is 41 years old. She earns a living through farming rice, while her husband works as a solider. Engaging in this business for 20 years together, they can earn about 39,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Son has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and completely paid back the past loan, which helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. Son is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Han is a villager living in a rural village of Ek Phnom district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is a 56-year-old widow with nine children. Han earns a living through farming rice. Having been involved in the rice-growing business for more than 30 years, she can earn approximately 26,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) daily and save about 9,000 KHR after deducting the daily expenses. 

Han has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for five loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in better supporting the family. Now she is in need of money to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay wages to farm laborers. Therefore, Han is leading a group of two female members to take out a loan in the amount of 2,400,000 KHR in total. 

In the near future, she expects a boost in her income via the help of her requested loan portion. Han is willing to use the anticipated income to send her beloved children to school and, hopefully, to build a bright future for them.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay wages to farm laborers.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
A 42-year-old married woman named Mon lives in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district in Kampong Cham district, Cambodia. She is blessed with five children, two (a daughter and a son) of whom are students. 

To offer a decent life for the family, Mon and her husband have been planting cassava for more than 10 years, earning around 45,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and saving approximately 27,000 KHR after canceling out the daily expenses. 

Mon is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the first time. With this first-time requested loan, she will pay the rental fee of a 2-hectare plot of farmland. Mon hopes to earn more income from the cassava-planting business so that she can pay back the loan and improve the family’s lifestyle as well as further advance her school-aged children’s education.

loans.use: To pay the rental fee of the farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel es transportista con una experiencia de 25 años, tiene 2 movilidades que con una de ellas trabaja como taxista, El motivo por el que solicita el crédito es por la razón de que sufrió un fallo de su motorizado con el que trabaja y tuvo que realizar reparaciones del mismo a pesar de aquello aún permanece con fallas en el buen funcionamiento y para ello requiere efectivo para dejar en buenas condiciones la movilidad. El Sr. Daniel no cuenta con recursos suficientes, ya que si no repara su taxi tendrá problemas económicos para subsistir y este crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Daniel is a driver with 25 years experiences.  He has two vehicles, and uses one to work as a taxi driver.  He is applying for a loan because the car he uses for work has a fault and he had to fix it.  Although it is now working, the car still has problems and he needs money to get the car into good shape.  Daniel does not have enough resources and if he does not repair his taxi he will have financial problems to live.  This loan will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La señora Claudia es una persona digna de admiración es madre soltera, tiene una hija a su cuidado, Matilde la cual tiene 3 años,  vive en el área rural a las afueras de la ciudad en una de las zonas más pobres de Cochabamba,  heredo la casa de sus padres, vive  con sus padres, estudio hasta nivel bachiller ya que tuvo que dejar los estudios porque se embarazo, su novio le abandono y a la fecha no se sabe nada de el,  trabaja de cajera en un Supermercado hace 5 años su horario de trabajo es de 8 de la mañana a las 3 de la tarde, de ahí vuelve a su casa y se dedica a vender comidas rápidas con su carrito de salchipapas, en el cual le va bien ya que genera mas ingresos en su actividad propia que trabajando en el supermercado, el motivo del presente crédito es la de comprar un carrito mas grande para poder elaborar en mayor cantidad y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Claudia is a woman worthy of admiration.  She is a single mother to her three year old daughter Matilde.  Claudia lives in a rural area on the outskirts of the city, and in one of Cochabamba's poorest districts.  Having inherited her parents' house, she now lives with her parents.  She studied for a Bachelor's degree but had to drop out when she fell pregnant.  Her boyfriend left her and she has not heard anything of him since.  For five years, Claudia has worked as a cashier in a supermarket, working from 8am until 3pm.  After work, she comes home and then works selling fast-food fried potatoes with hot dogs from her cart.  This work is going well for her as it generates more income than working in the supermarket.  She is applying for this loan to buy a bigger cart so that she can produce a higher quantity of food and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a cart to make fried potatoes with hot dogs.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: La Sra Ana es una persona trabajadora la cual no termino la secundaria  ya que de muy joven se embarazo, se casó a los 18 años a la fecha tiene 2 hijos Rafael y Josefina, el primero tiene 1 año y la niña tiene 3 años, Ana desde los 10 años perdió a sus padres vivía en  la casa de sus padrinos ellos le ayudaron hasta que se casó, ahora viven juntos en uno de los barrios más pobres de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona sud en el Barrio San Miguel ahí no tienen ningún tipo de servicios básicos,  Ana se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción, su especialidad son materiales de armado de losa liviana, vende plastoformos y viguetas por mayor, pero necesita más capital quiere comprar una mezcladora y ginche, ella venderá más de su material porque cuando vendan sus materiales de construcción les prestaran a los compradores la mezcladora y ginche.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working person that always gives her best. When she was very young she got pregnant and she married at 18 years of age.  She now has two children, Rafael and Josefina.  The oldest is 1 year old and her daughter is 3 months old.  10 years ago Ana lost her parents and moved into the home of her godparents. They helped her until she was married.  She now lives with her family in the poorest neighborhood in the city of Cochabamba.  It is located in the southern region of Cochabamba in a neighborhood called San Miguel.  She doesn't have any basic services in her home.

Ana sells construction supplies.  Her specialty is selling reinforced slabs.  She sells mostly plastoforms and joists but she needs more money to buy a mixer and a hoist.  This equipment will help her sell more materials because it is common and expected that when these construction materials are purchased, the buyers can borrow a hoist and mixer.

loans.use: to buy a mixer and a hoist.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos secos,la socia se siente feliz con su negocio ya que mediante este negocio la socia puede apoyar economicamente a su familia,la socia vende de manera ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.



La socia solicita el credito para la compra de trigo,cebada y maiz para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “San Martin de Zurite.”  The bank is located in the district of Zurite which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Jesusa.  She continues to work in the business of selling dry goods.  She feels happy with her business since by means of this business she can support her family economically.  She sells as a street vendor to her customers that request her.  She wants to be able to continue working for in this way she can continue supporting her family.

Jesusa is requesting the loan to purchase wheat, barley and corn for her business.

She is happy about the loan and she is committed to complying with her installment payments.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, barley and corn for her business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina;la socia sigue con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia se siente feliz con su negocio ya que mediante este la socia puede apoyar economicamente a su familia,la socia lleva años en este negocio, a la vez la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de verduras y productos secis,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.



La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz,azucar y leche para su tienda de abarrotes.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Sabina belongs to the communal bank San Martin de Zurite. The bank is located in the district of Zurite, province of Anta, department of Cusco. She continues working in her grocery store. She feels happy about the business because it allows her to support her family financially. She has spent a number of years in the business and continues selling vegetables and dry goods, and in this way she makes headway for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies like rice, sugar and milk for her store. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose a su negocio de venta de palos,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable  y con muchas ganas  de seguir trabajando por su familia y con este negocio la socia apoya economicamente a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de palos para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still running her business selling boards. She has been doing this for several years, and thanks to the effort she puts in every day it is going well. She is a responsible person and is eager to continue working for her family. It is through this business that she provides financial support to her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy boards for her business. 

She is happy about getting the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy boards for her business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de leche,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia tiene vacas las cuales cria y vende en las ferias y las misma vacas son las que producen la leche que la socia vende, la socia es un persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimento para sus vacas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elena continues her milk sales business, and has been working in this field for several years now. She believes that business is going well thanks to the high level of effort she puts into her work each and every day. She makes a living raising dairy cows and selling both cows and milk in local fairs and markets. 

Maria Elena is a responsible, sincere woman who works very hard to provide for her family. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase feed for her cows. She is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to complete all scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE,el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Zurite,provincia de Anta,departamento de Cusco.

La socia Haydee tiene 49 años de edad,tiene 03 hijos y es casada,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes ,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que mas le solicitan ,la socia a la vez tiene un kiosko escolar en uno de los colegios de la zona donde vende golosinas como dulces,galletas,chicles entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cupoast establecidas.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Community Bank SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE, which is located in the Zurite district in the province of Anta, department of Cusco. Haydee is 49 years old, and is married with three children. She makes a living raising small animals such as guinea pigs for resale to her customers and in local markets. 

Haydee also operates a small convenience store just across the street from a high school, where she sells candy, snacks and other items to the students. She believes that business is going well thanks to the high level of effort she puts into her work each and every day. Her two businesses are the primary source of income for her family, and she is requesting this loan in hopes of strengthening her business by purchasing guinea pigs for resale. Haydee is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to complete scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como pollos y cuyes,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cria  a estos animalitos para luego venderlos en las diferentes ferias,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina continues her business raising and selling small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has been working in this area for several years now, and she believes that business is going well thanks to the high level of effort she puts into her work each and every day. Josefina breeds animals for resale in various local markets and fairs, and her business is the primary source of income for her family.

With the support from this loan, Josefina plans to purchase guinea pigs for her business. She is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to make all scheduled repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs for resale at her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Martha, la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de cosmeticos,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende su mercaderia por catalogos ofreciendo a sus amistades,familiares y clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderia como perfumes y colonias.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called RENACER and is located in the Huanchac district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

Martha, a member, continues with her business of buying and selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She sells her by catalog to her friends, family, and customers who request her merchandise.  This is the way she gets her family ahead. 

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like perfume and cologne.  She is grateful, and she wishes to say that she will make her scheduled payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like perfume and cologne.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Juan Carlos, el socio continua confeccionando muebles en melamina,el socio lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio es carpinero siendo su especialidad trabajos hechos a base de malamina,el socio continua llevando sus trabajos los dias de feria por el centro de la ciudad, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

 El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su negocio.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The Community Bank RENACER is located in the Huanchac District in the Department and Province of Cusco. Juan Carlos, a member of the community bank, operates a furniture business and has been crafting furniture for several years now. He believes that business is going well thanks to the high level of effort he puts in each and every day to his work. Juan Carlos is a carpenter who specializes in laminate wood furniture. On days when the fair convenes in Cusco, he takes his handiwork to the market for sale.  

The carpentry business is Juan Carlos' primary means of supporting his family, and he plans to use the support from this loan to purchase tools for his carpentry business. He is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to complete all repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Zoila, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende a sus amistades,familiares,clientes que le solicitan,la socia trabaja a pedido por catalogos, a la vez la socia es docente de profesion, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de perfumes y colonias para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila is a member of the Communal Bank named “Renacer” (To Be Reborn), which is located in the District of Huanchac in the Province and Department of Cusco.

Zoila continues her business of selling beauty products. She has been in this line of work for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. Zoila sells her products to friends, relatives, and customers who place orders with her. She works by submitting orders through catalogs. Zoila is also a teacher by profession, so working in this manner enables her to move her family forward.

Zoila is requesting a loan so that she can buy perfumes and colognes for her business. She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: Sonia Rufina's Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMIGOS DEL MILENIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Sonia Rufina ella es soltera y tiene 33 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de imprenta, la socia hace trabajos como tarjetas de cumpleaños, tarjetas de invitación entre otros trabajos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 11 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de imprenta. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papeles, tintas para la impresora.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal, se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de vidrios, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Amigos del Milenio Communal Bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province in Cusco department. 

The featured member is Sra. Sonia Rufina. She is 33 years old, unmarried and has two children. This member has a print shop business. The member produces products such as birthday cards and invitations, among other items. The member works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. The member has operated this business for 11 years and it is going well. The member’s dream is to expand her printing business. The member is requesting a loan in order to purchase paper and ink for her printer.

The two small snapshots attached to the group photo are of members who had their pictures taken after the group shot. They requested permission to be absent due to work requirements.

The other members have businesses selling glassworks, operating a grocery store, selling clothing and selling beauty products.

The featured member is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase paper and ink for her printer.

loans.name: Vida Abundante Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Margarita que se dedica a  la venta de gaseosas, jugos, desde hace 10 años, es una mujer casada, con tres hijos menores, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, jugos variados de sabor este negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, Victoria vende ropa y María vende ropa ambulante.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is Margarita, who has been selling sodas and juices for 10 years. She is a married woman with three young children. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of sodas and juices of various flavors. Her business is located in her home.

The other members are as follows: • Victoria sells clothes. • María sells clothes as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sodas and juices.

loans.name: El Trebol Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores originarias de Masaya una de ellas es Silvia de 45 años de edad, acompañada con dos hijos. Se dedica a la venta de sandalia al detalle ambulante actividad que viene realizando desde hace dos años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sandalias de todo tipo, variedad y diferentes edades, Elba vende ropa y José Luis tiene un taller de panadería.
texts.en:
The group El Trebol is made up of three entrepreneurs who are all from the city of Masaya. Silvia, one of the members, is 45 years old and has two children. She operates a business traveling around selling all styles and sizes of sandals. Silvia has been working in this profession for two years now, and she plans to use the support from this loan to purchase various types of sandals to further stock her business. 

Elba, the other woman in this trio, sells clothing, and José Luis operates a bakery.

loans.use: to purchase all styles and sizes of sandals for resale.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: El Señor Patricio de 27 años de edad conviviente más de 3 años con la señora Claudia, ambos con una instrucción de nivel primario, tienen 3 hijos dependientes de los cuales estudian 2, la familia vive en una comunidad rural lejana a 11 km hacia el norte de Colomi. Don Patricio y su esposa cuentan con una actividad económica la agricultura, vende papa, papaliza, haba y oca de esta forma ellos mantienen económicamente a sus hijos en su estudio y su alimentación, ellos necesitan un crédito para construir su propia vivienda ya que actualmente viven en un domicilio de un amigo y su sueño es tener su propia vivienda y por este motivo necesitan un préstamo ya que el ahorro que tenían invirtieron en compra de insumos agrícolas.      Ellos están muy  entusiasmados por iniciar la construcción de su nueva vivienda porque siempre soñaron en vivir en una casa propia.
texts.en:
Patricio is 27 years old and has been living with Claudia for more than 3 years. Both received primary education. They have 3 dependent children, two of whom are going to school. The family lives in an isolated rural community, 11km north of Colomi. The economic activity of Patricio and his wife is agriculture. They sell potatoes, ulluco (a potato-like tuber, grown in Andean regions), beans and oca (an Andean root vegetable). This provides the financial support required to educate and feed their children. 

They are requesting a loan to build their own house, as at the moment they live in a friend’s house. Their dream is to have their own home. They have invested their savings in agricultural supplies and so need a loan. They are very enthusiastic about starting the building work on their new house as they have always dreamed of living in their own home.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR  VIRGILIO DE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD CASADO TIENE CUATRO HIJOS QUE ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA DE SU COMUNIDAD QUE ESTA A UNOS 5 KM DEL LUGAR DONDE VIVEN,  DON VIRGILIO SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA POR MAS DE VEINTE AÑOS, EN LA ANTERIOR COSECHA HUBO  DESASTRE NATURAL DE SEQUÍA Y SUS CULTIVOS BAJARON DE RENDIMIENTO POR LA FALTA DE AGUA, ESTE DESASTRE LE HIZO FRACASAR EN SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS, LLEGANDO AFECTAR A TODA SU FAMILIA QUE SE MANTENÍAN CON LAS COSECHAS QUE CADA AÑO PRODUCEN. 
VIRGILIO  ES UNA PERSONA  MUY QUERIDA Y RESPETADA EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE, POR LO DEDICADO A SUS HIJOS  Y SU TRABAJO, HAY DÍAS QUE TIENE QUE TRABAJAR EN JORNAL EN LA AGRICULTURA PARA GANAR ALGUNOS PESOS DEMÁS Y ASÍ MANTENER A SUS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. EL  ESTÁ SOLICITANDO EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR  ABONO QUÍMICO,  PRODUCTOS AGROQUÍMICOS Y SEMILLA DE PAPA Y DE ESTA FORMA PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD Y EL RENDIMIENTO DE SUS CULTIVOS, TRABAJA EN SU PEQUEÑA PARCELA QUE TIENE EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE, EL ESPERA  MEJORAR SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS Y  DARLE UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SUS HIJOS Y QUE ELLOS  PUEDAN ASISTIR A LA ESCUELA  EN MEJORES CONDICIONES.  EL CRÉDITO AYUDARÁ MUCHO A TODA SU FAMILIA Y AL DURO  TRABAJO QUE REALIZAN TODOS LOS DÍAS.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 45 years old and married with four children. His children attend the school in his community, which is 5 kilometers away from their home.

Virgilio has made a living in agriculture for more than 20 years. There was a drought during the last harvest, and he lost crop yield because of the lack of water. This disaster caused a failure in his earnings. This eventually affected his entire family, who depend on the harvests that he produces every year.

Virgilio is a very beloved and respected person in his community because of his dedication to his children and his work. There area days when he has to work as a day laborer on a farm to earn some extra pesos to provide for his children.

He is applying for this loan to buy chemical fertilizer, agrochemical products, and potato seeds. He will then be able to improve the quality and yield of his crops. He has a small plot of land where he works in his community. 

He hopes to improve his income and give his children a better quality of life, so they can go to school in better conditions. This loan will help his entire family and the hard work which they do every day.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer, agrochemical products and potato seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to use in his work as a cook and baker which will save him the time and expense of using the public oven.

loans.name: Tismayan Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Nimia de 51 años de edad, unión libre con dos hijos mayores desde hace 30 años vende leche al detalle, tiene cuatro familiares remunerados en la distribución de la leche, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de leche, Ana tiene una pulpería, Leyda vende ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The trio Tismayan is made up of three entrepreneurial, successful women. Nimia, one of the group members, is 51 and is married with three adult children. For the past 30 years she has operated a business selling milk, and has even employed four of her family members at different times to help with delivery and distribution. Nimia plans to use the support from this loan to purchase milk for resale.

Ana, another entrepreneur in the group, operates a convenience store, and Leyda, the third businesswoman, makes a living selling new clothing.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale in her business.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo, es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene un dependiente bajo su cuidado, él tiene 26 años de edad.  Trabaja como maestro albañil su trabajo es peligroso, sin embargo es el único sustento que tiene para poder sacar adelante a su familia. También trabaja en el armado de torres eléctricas trabajo que está catalogado como uno de los más peligrosos. Reynaldo necesita un préstamo para poder terminar de construir su vivienda que con tanto sacrificio ha logrado edificar el mismo. Con esto podrá contar con una muralla para que su pequeño hijo pueda desenvolverse y estar en un lugar seguro. Él está muy emocionado de poder continuar con la construcción en su vivienda y más adelante también tiene planeado regularizar los documentos de su vivienda y así tener  todo en orden por la seguridad de su hijo.
texts.en: Sr. Reynaldo is a very hard-working person. He is 26 and has one dependent under his care. He works as a master builder. His work is dangerous, but it is the only way that he can get his family ahead. He also works on power lines, which is known to be one of the most dangerous jobs available. Reynaldo needs a loan in order to finish building his home, which he has managed to build through great sacrifice. With this loan, he will be able to build a wall. This way, his little son will be able to grow in a safe environment. Reynaldo is very excited to be able to keep working on building his home. For the future, he plans to get the paperwork for his home in order for the sake of his son's security.

loans.use: to build a home.

loans.name: Inlimite Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores  una de ellas es Rebeca es una mujer  casada, tiene 7 años de comercializar   ropa y calzado al detalle y al crédito, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de ropa variada para todas las edades como pantalón de dama y caballeros, camisas unisex, camisas de mujer, ropa íntima, sandalias etc. Fanny vende cosméticos de la Avon y Roberto brinda servicio de transportes moto taxis.
texts.en:
This group consists of three entrepreneurs. One of them is a married woman named Rebeca. She has been selling clothing and shoes on credit for seven years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of various types of clothing for all ages such as men’s and women’s trousers, unisex shirts, women’s shirts, lingerie, sandals, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Fanny sells Avon cosmetics. • Roberto provides motorcycle taxi services.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothing.

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
Cupertino de 54 años de edad es un campesino dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 20 años. En compañía de su cuñado tomaron la decisión de realizar un sembrado de fríjol, en una pequeña parcela que arrearon con el fin de generar ingresos para las dos familias. 
Cupertino desea poder sacar adelante a sus nueve hijos y poderles ofrecer una vida digna, para ello se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que destinará para la compra de abonos y fungicidas. 
 Su mayor sueño es poder tener su propio terreno y construir una vivienda para su familia. Uno de sus más grandes retos en su proyecto de negocio ha sido el clima, debido a que las fuertes lluvias y el caluroso verano le generan grandes pérdidas en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Cupertino is a farmer who has been working in agriculture for 20 years.  He and his brother-in-law made the decision to grow beans on a small plot they cleared so they could make money for their two families. 

Cupertino wants to be able to get his nine children ahead and offer them a decent life, which is why he is looking for a loan that he will use to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

His greatest dream is to have his own land and to build a home for his family.  One of the greatest challenges to his business has been the weather, as strong rains and the heat of summer incur great losses in his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides for his bean crops

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis Alfonso de 34 años de edad, es un hombre con una gran experiencia en el sector comercial, desde joven laboró en diferentes negocios de su localidad, por lo cual adquirió la experiencia para montar su propia empresa.
“Aunque el camino no fue fácil para lograr cumplir mi sueño de montar empresa, hoy miro atrás y me doy cuenta que nunca fue perdido, que todo lo que he vivido me ha conducido a una vida mejor” Con estas palabras, Luis manifiesta como ha sido su proceso desde que inició con su idea de negocio. Hoy es un gran orgullo para su familia, porque con su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante a sus dos hijos menores de edad. Su mayor sueño es poder expandir su negocio y generar fuentes de empleo en su localidad. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido. De esta manera espera poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso, 34, is a man with great experience in business. Since he was young, he has been working in different establishments in his town; this is how he accumulated enough experience to start his own business.

“Although the road leading to my dream of starting a business was bumpy, I look back and realize that nothing was in vain, that everything I have experienced has led me to a better life.” With these words, Luis explains how the process started, from the first time he thought of starting the business.

Today, his family feels proud of him, because with hard work and commitment he has been able to raise his two underage children. His biggest dream is to be able to expand his business and create job opportunities for his neighbors, and this is why he is requesting a loan to restock his store. He expects to increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: María Del Consuelo

texts.es:
María de 62 años de edad, enviudó, situación que la obligó a desarrollar una fuente de empleo que le permitiera generar los ingresos necesarios para subsistir. Con pocas oportunidades de acceder al mundo laboral, decidió enfocarse en el sector agropecuario y construyó un galpón en su casa para la cría de gallinas ponedoras, con el propósito de vender huevos. Esta actividad, le ha permitido obtener los recursos para vivir y solventar sus necesidades básicas. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un nuevo galpón debido a que por el tiempo y el uso éste se encuentra en mal estado. El dinero sobrante lo invertía en la compra de gallinas.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su calidad de vida sin preocuparse por el factor económico, disfrutar de una vida feliz y tranquila al lado de las personas que más ama.
texts.en:
Maria is a 62 year old who, being a widow, was forced in developing a source of employment which would allow her to earn some necessary income to live on. With the little chance she has of entering the work force, she decided to focus on agricultural livestock and built a coop in her house to raise laying hens, with the idea of selling eggs. This activity has allowed her to obtain the necessary resources to live and cover her basic needs. 

At the moment she is requesting a loan to build a new coop due to the poor condition of her previous one, which over time and with use has deteriorated. The money she has left over will be used to buy chickens.

Her biggest dream is to be able to improve her quality of life without having to worry about her economy, enjoy a happy and quiet life by the side of the people she loves.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop and buy chickens.

loans.name: Dios Nos Bendice Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Leyda se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la Avon y recargas electrónicas de tiempo aire de la empresas Claro Y Movistar, es una mujer casada con 20 años de edad, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como  perfumen, pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, delineadores, tintes, y compra de recargas electrónicas de tiempo aire, Pilar vende cosméticos de la Avon y María vende comida y refrescos naturales.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Loyda, who makes a living selling Avon cosmetics and electronic recharges of cell phone minutes for the businesses Claro and Movistar.  She is a married woman who is 20 years old.  Her husband helps her in the business.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of Avon cosmetics like perfume, lipstick, nail polish, eyeliner and dyes as well as to purchase electronic recharges of cell phone minutes.  

Pilar sells Avon cosmetics and María sells food and natural soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase Avon cosmetics like perfume, lipstick, nail polish, eye liner and dyes as well as to purchase electronic recharges of cell phone minutes.

loans.name: Misericordia Del Señor Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gloria tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tres hijos y tiene 6 años de tener su negocio  de venta de ropa usada. EL crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa usada, Ruth vende cuajadas, cosas de horno y Carla vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group has three members; one of whom is 41-year-old Gloria, an enterprising woman who is married with three children. For six years, Gloria has had her own business selling second-hand clothing. 

This loan will be used to buy bales of used clothing.

The second member Ruth sells curds and baked goods, and Carla also sells used clothing.

loans.use: to invest in bales of used clothing

loans.name: Don Claudio Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores de éxito uno de ellos es Angel  que desde hace 6 años vende zapatos, sandalias, de todo tipo de estilos y medidas ambulante, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos y sandalias, Araceli vende ropa usada, Gloria vende ropa nueva y Claudio de los Santos es agricultor, siembra hortalizas, frijoles, sandias, cítricos y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semillas mejorada, insecticidas, abono, preparación del terreno.
texts.en: This group has four successful and enterprising members  One of them is Angel who, for six years now, has been a street vendor selling all types shoes and sandals.  He will invest this loan in buying shoes and sandals.  Araceli sells used clothing while Gloria sells new clothes.  Claudio de los Santos is a farmer.  He grows vegetables, beans, watermelons and citrus fruits.  He will use the loan to buy better seeds, insecticides, fertilizer and to prepare the land.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La Sra., Felicidad, tiene  47 años de edad, está casada con el señor Severo, se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, en donde actualmente tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y 2 cabezas en gestación, y también produce  quesillo, actualmente la Sra. Felicidad vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive es familiar, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, el destino del crédito es para la compra de cabeza de ganado lechero, para aumentar sus ingresos  por la venta de quesillo, y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su domicilio. Para ella será de gran ayuda puesto que es una señora de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Felicidad is 47 years old, she is married, and she works as a dairy farmer.  She has three dairy cows that are currently producing milk and two other cows that are both pregnant.  She also produces fresh cheese from the milk of these cows. Felicidad lives in the region outside of the city of Cochabamba, approximately 10 km (6 miles) from the city of Cochabamba. She lives in a house with her husband and their children.

This loan will be used for the purchase of another dairy cow so that she can increase her income by selling more fresh cheese. The increase in income will help her meet the household needs.  For Felicidad, this will be a big help because she lacks economic resources.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Deyanira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Deyanira es una mujer casada con un hijo que se dedica a vender mercadería en general como ropa de adultos, ropa interior , esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para adultos, ropa de niña, ropa interior, calzados variados etc.
texts.en:
Deyanira is married with one son. She sells general merchandise, adult clothing and underwear and has had this business for six years. 

This loan will be invested in adult clothes, girls clothes, underwear and a variety of footwear.

loans.use: to buy adult clothes, girls clothes, underwear and a variety of footwear, etc.

loans.name: Veronica Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Verónica desde hace 24 años se dedica a vender productos de artesanías, es una mujer casada, con tres hijos mayores quienes le ayudan a vender en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de artesanías  de adornos como mariposas, soles, lunas, girasoles, etc. Claudia también vende artesanías y Katty vende artesanías nacionales.
texts.en:
This group has three members, one of whom is Veronica, 42, and enterprising lady who has a business selling craft items. Veronica is married with three adult children, who help out with the business. 

This loan will be used to buy embellishments for craft items such as butterflies, suns, moons, sunflowers, etc. Member Claudia also sells crafts, while Kitty sells national handicrafts.
